title: Strawberries will be available out of season!
headline: üçìStrawberry: OpenAI's Next Big Leap in AI OpenAI's Upcoming Model Promises to Revolutionize Mathematical Reasoning and Programming. OpenAI is gearing up to release its latest AI model, codenamed "Strawberry," this fall.
post_text: üçìStrawberry: OpenAI's Next Big Leap in AI OpenAI's Upcoming Model Promises to Revolutionize Mathematical Reasoning and Programming. OpenAI is gearing up to release its latest AI model, codenamed "Strawberry," this fall. The model, initially known as "Q*" or "Q-Star," is poised to significantly outperform previous models like GPT-4, especially in tasks requiring complex mathematical reasoning and high-level problem-solving. Key Features and Potential: Advanced Mathematical Capabilities : Strawberry is expected to achieve a remarkable 90% accuracy on math benchmarks, far surpassing GPT-4's 53%. This breakthrough could revolutionize fields like scientific research, engineering, and education. Enhanced Programming Skills : The model's ability to handle intricate programming tasks will likely accelerate software development and improve code quality. Strategic Thinking and Problem Solving : Strawberry's potential to excel in tasks like developing marketing strategies and solving complex word puzzles demonstrates its versatility and real-world applications. Controversy and Concerns: While Strawberry promises to be a significant advancement, it has also sparked internal debates at OpenAI. Concerns about the model's potential to approach artificial general intelligence (AGI) have raised alarms about the risks of losing control over such powerful AI systems. These fears echo the ongoing discussions about aligning AI with human values. The Road to Orion: A larger version of Strawberry is being used to develop "Orion," the next big successor to GPT-4. Orion is anticipated to leverage synthetic data to improve training and reduce AI "hallucinations," making it even more reliable and capable. OpenAI's Competitive Edge: The release of Strawberry is seen as a crucial step for OpenAI to maintain its leadership in the rapidly evolving AI landscape. As other tech giants race to develop advanced AI models, OpenAI's commitment to pushing the boundaries of AI research is evident. üì¢Generative AI, the largest AI community, announced their strategic partnership with NVIDIA and started the crowdfunding campaign.üöÄ With 7 million strong AI enthusiasts and professionals in our Generative AI community, this partnership marks a monumental step forward in our mission to discover, learn, and grow together in the AI landscape. Our community now have access to NVIDIA ‚Äôs cutting-edge tools, resources, and technologies that are transforming industries worldwide. This collaboration opens up incredible opportunities for our community, including exclusive tutorials, forums, and support tools tailored for AI innovators. Stay tuned for more exciting updates as we dive deeper into this partnership. We‚Äôre just getting started, and we can‚Äôt wait to explore the future of AI with all of you! üëâ Join us as we shape the future of Generative AI üí¨Google Gems: Your Personalized AI Assistants Google Gems is a new feature within Google Gemini that allows users to create custom AI assistants tailored to specific needs. Think of them as your AI experts, ready to assist you with various tasks. How do Google Gems work? Create Your Gem: Simply give your Gem a name and describe its purpose. For example, you might create a "Coding Buddy" to help with programming tasks or a "Travel Planner" to assist with trip planning. Train Your Gem: Provide your Gem with specific instructions, examples, or even a document to learn from. The more information you give, the better it will be able to assist you. Start Using Your Gem: Ask your Gem questions, give it tasks, or request information. It will use its knowledge and abilities to provide helpful responses. What can Google Gems do? The possibilities are endless! Here are a few examples of what Google Gems can help you with: Writing: Create drafts, brainstorm ideas, or proofread your work. Coding: Get help with debugging, writing code snippets, or learning new programming languages. Research: Find information on a variety of topics, from history to science. Creativity: Generate ideas for stories, poems, or other creative projects. Language Learning: Practice speaking, writing, or translating languages. Key benefits of Google Gems: Customization: Create a Gem that is perfectly suited to your needs. Efficiency: Get help with tasks quickly and easily. Learning: Learn new skills and knowledge from your Gem. Fun: Have fun exploring the creative possibilities of AI. üöÄ Breaking News: NVIDIA Blackwell Revolutionizes Generative AI Performance! NVIDIA has just unveiled groundbreaking results in the latest MLPerf Inference v4.1 benchmarks: ‚úîThe upcoming NVIDIA Blackwell platform delivers up to 4x more performance than NVIDIA H100 Tensor Core GPUs on the Llama 2 70B LLM workload. ‚úî NVIDIA Hopper GPUs lead in every generative AI data center test, including Llama 2 70B, GPT-J, Stable Diffusion XL and the new Mixtral 8x7B Mixture-of-Experts LLM. This showcase of NVIDIA's performance leadership spans from data centers to edge devices, powering the next wave of AI-driven applications and services. Here are details as NVIDIA continues to push the boundaries of AI computation! Neural Networks Power Real-Time DOOM Google researchers just unveiled GameNGen, the first game engine entirely driven by a neural model, capable of real-time interaction within complex environments. This groundbreaking AI doesn‚Äôt just replicate the classic game DOOM; it simulates it at over 20 frames per second on a single TPU, offering an interactive experience that‚Äôs nearly indistinguishable from the original. Details: GameNGen : The AI predicts each frame using a diffusion model, enabling real-time gameplay without traditional game engine components. Training Data : The AI was trained on 900M frames generated by an RL-agent playing DOOM. This extensive dataset allowed GameNGen to learn how to accurately simulate gameplay sequences. Diffusion Model: The system uses a customized version of Stable Diffusion v1.4, conditioned on past frames and actions. To prevent visual degradation during long sequences, the model was trained with deliberately corrupted context frames, which improved its ability to correct errors and maintain visual fidelity. Fine-Tuning: The latent decoder of the model was fine-tuned to address artifacts, particularly in detailed areas like the HUD, improving the overall quality of the generated frames. In tests, human raters could barely distinguish between short clips generated by GameNGen and actual gameplay, with accuracy only slightly better than random chance. GameNGen marks the first instance of an AI model generating a complex, playable video game in real-time without any traditional game engine. Imagine a time where each player‚Äôs game is uniquely generated, evolving based on their preferences and playstyle, starting a new AI era of gaming and entertainment. ü§ùArizona State University partners with OpenAI to give education a twist like never before Big news from the desert! Arizona State University (ASU) is making waves in the world of higher education by creating a partnership with OpenAI. The initiative, dubbed ChatGPT Edu, is set to rewrite how we approach teaching, research, and even day-to-day operations on campus. Picture this: students getting real-time feedback on their essays from an AI writing buddy, or future healthcare providers practising their bedside manner with a virtual patient named Sam. Sounds like science fiction, right? Well, it's happening right now at ASU. They aren't stopping there. They've thrown down the gauntlet with an AI Innovation Challenge the faculty really stepped up. We're talking about a whopping 80% of schools and colleges jumping on board in just a few weeks. As we speak, 400 proposals are under review, and over 200 ChatGPT Edu projects are already off the ground. What's in it for the ASU community? Students get a personal writing coach Healthcare students can practise tricky conversations without the stage fright Researchers can fast-track their work (more breakthroughs, less paperwork) ASU President Michael M. Crow is all in, calling innovation their "most powerful asset" and betting big on AI to supercharge lifelong learning. However, not everyone's entirely thrilled about this news. Harvard lecturer Erik Baker is waving a red flag, worried that AI might put a dent in students' writing skills. Love it or hate it, ASU's bold move is stirring up quite the conversation. As one of the biggest public universities in the country, all eyes are on this experiment. Could this be the blueprint for higher education in the coming decades? üß†Scientists looking to harness AI to detect and predict dementia risk in patients Source: BBC News In a landmark initiative, Scottish researchers are harnessing the power of artificial intelligence to predict dementia years before symptoms appear. The project, dubbed Scan-Dan is set to analyze over 1.6 million brain scans from patients across Scotland. Led by a team of 20 researchers from the Universities of Edinburgh and Dundee, this ambitious effort is the largest of its kind in the UK. For the first time, scientists have been granted access to a decade's worth of CT and MRI scans collected during routine clinical care from 2008 to 2018. Key Points: The project aims to identify early molecular changes in the brain that signal dementia. AI will be used to detect patterns in scans that could predict dementia risk. The goal is to create tools to help radiologists detect the disease early. Professor remained optimistic and quoted that: "While we can't be certain what patterns we'll find, the sheer size of our dataset gives us confidence in identifying dementia's early warning signs." Early detection is crucial as it allows for more effective treatments and lifestyle adjustments to slow the disease's progression. While a full product is still years away, this research marks a significant step towards better care for dementia patients. I will be speaking at Seamless , It is a unique global event brand bringing together the converging worlds of the banking financial services industry and the retail and e-commerce ecosystem. But it‚Äôs more than this. It‚Äôs a global community made up of decision-makers from large Enterprise, SME‚Äôs, start-ups, NGO‚Äôs, Regulators and Government, all actively engaged in driving change in digital commerce. Join over 5,000 attendees at #SeamlessNA in 2024! üöÄ OpenAI Launches Fine-Tuning for GPT-4o: Enhanced Performance and Customization In a significant development, OpenAI has introduced fine-tuning capabilities for its powerful GPT-4o AI model üíª. This update enables developers to tailor the model's performance to specific use cases by training it on their own datasets üìä. To encourage adoption, OpenAI is offering 1 million free training tokens per day for every organization until September 23rd üéÅ. Fine-tuning allows developers to refine the model's responses, adapt its tone and structure, and even train it to follow complex instructions ü§î. Early results show significant improvements can be achieved with relatively small training datasets üìà. Access to fine-tuning is available through OpenAI's dashboard, with pricing set at $25 per million tokens for training and $3.75 per million input tokens for inference üí∏. Notable success stories include Cosine's Genie, an AI software engineering assistant powered by a fine-tuned GPT-4o model, achieving state-of-the-art results on the SWE-bench benchmark üèÜ, and Distyl's Text-to-SQL Model securing first place on the BIRD-SQL benchmark üìä. This update marks a significant milestone in AI customization and performance enhancement üî•. Stay tuned for more developments in the AI space! ü§ñ üìöAuthors sue Anthropic for training Claude with pirated versions of copyrighted books A group of writers filed a lawsuit against AI company Anthropic, claiming the firm used pirated versions of their copyrighted books without permission to train its AI assistant, Claude. This is the first time authors have targeted Anthropic specifically, though similar cases have been on the rise, against the likes of AI companies like OpenAI. Anthropic, started by former OpenAI employees, has tried to position itself as a responsible player in AI development. Their chatbot Claude can help with various tasks like writing emails, summarizing documents, and holding conversations. However, this lawsuit challenges the company's ethical stance, and questions how it is AI for good when it uses blatantly unathorized materials. The lawsuit makes a few important claims: Claude was allegedly trained using a dataset called The Pile, which the authors say contains unauthorized copies of books. The writers argue that AI learning is different from human learning, and authors should be compensated for the use of their work. They say Anthropic's actions don't line up with its stated commitment to developing AI responsibly. In a way, this Anthropic lawsuit is part of a larger trend of copyright lawsuits against AI companies. Other firms like OpenAI and Microsoft are in the midst of such feuds with well-known writers such as George R.R. Martin and Jodi Picoult. These cases highlight a growing debate about AI companies using large amounts of human-created content without getting permission first. In an era where we constantly debate and deliberate about AI‚Äôs role in creative fields and ponder over AI replacing humans, it is indeed puzzling that AI uses human-made material without fairly compensating the owners of the intellectual property! The outcome of this case will set a promising precedent for future usage of available literature in training advanced AI models .

According to insider sources, the startup, founded just three
post_text: üíº OpenAI co-founder Sutskever's new safety-focused AI startup SSI raises $1 billion Safe Superintelligence (SSI), co-founded by OpenAI‚Äôs former chief scientist Ilya Sutskever, has secured $1 billion to develop advanced, safe AI systems. According to insider sources, the startup, founded just three months ago, is already valued at $5 billion. Daniel Gross, Ilya Sutskever, and Daniel Levy, cofounders of AI company Safe Superintelligence, pose for a photo in this handout in August 2024. Important Details: Mission-Driven Approach : SSI aims to build AI systems that surpass human capabilities while prioritizing safety. It plans to focus heavily on research and development (R&D) before launching its products, ensuring a meticulous and thoughtful approach to AI safety. Strategic Use of Funds : The funds will be allocated to acquiring computing power and recruiting top talent. SSI‚Äôs team of 10 employees will be split between Palo Alto, California, and Tel Aviv, Israel, with a core focus on assembling a highly trusted team of researchers and engineers. Notable Investors: The funding round saw participation from prestigious venture capital firms such as Andreessen Horowitz, Sequoia Capital, DST Global, and SV Angel. SSI‚Äôs CEO, Daniel Gross, emphasized the importance of investors aligning with the company‚Äôs vision of developing safe superintelligence. AI Safety Focus: With growing concerns about the risks of rogue AI, SSI is positioned to play a leading role in ensuring that AI systems remain safe and aligned with human values, particularly as AI technology advances. Looking Ahead: SSI's formation reflects the continued interest in foundational AI research, even as the broader industry faces challenges with unprofitable ventures. SSI hopes to create groundbreaking AI technologies by focusing on safety and innovation while clearly focusing on ethical considerations. üî•üî•üî• At Generative AI, we‚Äôre at the forefront of this innovation, building an AI-native learning platform that prioritizes speed, accuracy, and ultra-personalization. Join us as we shape the future of AI-driven education. Navigating the Top AI Developments, Investments and Innovations In this insightful report, dive into: Generative AI Innovations and Use Cases. Where are the Generative AI Investments going? Influential Industry Trends. The Impact of Regulation. Challenges and Opportunities for the Future. üìà Get your complimentary copy of this report now >>> üì∏ OpenAI Japan CEO Reveals Groundbreaking AI Model: GPT-Next At the recent KDDI Summit 2024, OpenAI Japan's CEO, Tadao Nagasaki, shared exciting details about the future of AI, revealing that GPT-Next will be 100 times more powerful than GPT-4, offering a significant leap in AI capabilities. The model mentioned by Tadao Nagasaki is tipped to be the next big leap in AI Image source: ITMediaAI+ Key Highlights: Massive Power Boost: GPT-Next, the upcoming model from OpenAI, is set to outperform GPT-4 by 100 times. According to Nagasaki, this significant improvement is due to better architecture rather than increased computing resources. Project Strawberry Integration: GPT-Next will utilize a scaled-down version of OpenAI‚Äôs mysterious "Project Strawberry," speculated to bring unprecedented advances in AI functionality. Rapid Growth of ChatGPT: Nagasaki mentioned that ChatGPT's active users have surpassed 200 million as of August 2024. ChatGPT has become the fastest software in history to reach this user milestone, highlighting its user-friendly design. Enterprise Adoption: ChatGPT Enterprise is witnessing an increased adoption rate among companies as businesses worldwide leverage AI's potential in their operations. Global Presence & Expansion: OpenAI, with around 2000 employees globally, continues its mission to expand AI development. The CEO explained Japan‚Äôs selection as OpenAI's first Asian base, citing the nation's longstanding commitment to innovation and technology. Looking Ahead: Nagasaki emphasized OpenAI's vision of accelerating AI‚Äôs role in the world, supporting exponential growth, and creating new AI models to redefine the future. GPT-Next is expected to play a pivotal role in this journey. Don't miss this free webinar. You‚Äôll learn: The fundamentals of SingleStore Auto-Scaling and its benefits. How to configure and set thresholds for automatic scaling. Best practices for monitoring and adjusting your auto-scaling settings. Real-world use cases demonstrating the impact of effective auto-scaling. A live demonstration of setting up auto-scaling. üëâ Sign up here! üíªCrowdStrike and Microsoft: Navigating the Aftermath of a Global IT Outage A Recap of the July 19th Incident The global IT outage caused by a faulty CrowdStrike update on July 19th sent shockwaves through various industries. It disrupted operations at banks, airlines, healthcare facilities, and countless other businesses. The incident, which affected 8.5 million Windows PCs and servers, highlighted the critical role of cybersecurity in maintaining essential services. CrowdStrike's Response and Future Measures CrowdStrike has acknowledged the error and has been working diligently to rectify the issue. The company has implemented measures to prevent similar occurrences in the future, including more rigorous testing of content updates, improved error handling, and a staggered deployment process. Microsoft's Role and Windows Security Summit Microsoft has played a pivotal role in assisting affected organizations. The company released a bootable USB drive tool to aid in system restoration. Additionally, Microsoft is hosting a Windows Endpoint Security Ecosystem Summit in September to discuss ways to enhance Windows security and prevent future incidents. Industry Impact and Compensation Claims The outage had a significant impact on businesses worldwide. Delta Airlines, for instance, canceled over 600 flights due to the disruption. Delta's CEO has sought compensation from both CrowdStrike and Microsoft for the financial losses incurred. Microsoft, however, has refuted Delta's claims, stating that Delta had declined previous offers of assistance. Beyond Technology: Human Impact and Ethical Considerations The outage also shed light on the human impact of technology failures. The incident exposed vulnerabilities in critical infrastructure and raised questions about the ethical responsibilities of cybersecurity firms. The MrBeast reality game show incident further underscored the importance of prioritizing human welfare even in the face of technological challenges. Moving Forward: Lessons Learned and Future Outlook The CrowdStrike incident serves as a stark reminder of the interconnectedness of our digital world. It underscores the need for robust cybersecurity measures, effective incident response plans, and a focus on human safety and well-being. As businesses and governments continue to rely heavily on technology, it is essential to learn from past mistakes and strive for a more resilient and secure digital future. ü§ñAI's Self-Cannibalization: The Downfall of Quality Search Results Sam Altman indicated it's impossible to create ChatGPT without copyrighted material, but a new study claims 57% of the content on the internet is AI-generated and is subtly killing quality search results. A groundbreaking new study has exposed a startling trend: over 57% of the content on the internet is now AI-generated. This explosion of AI-created content is not only reshaping the digital landscape but also posing serious challenges to AI tools themselves. The Vicious Cycle of AI-Generated Content AI powerhouses like ChatGPT and Copilot rely on vast troves of internet data for training. However, as the internet becomes increasingly saturated with AI-generated content, these tools are essentially being trained on their own output. This self-referential loop is leading to a concerning degradation in the quality of responses and a rise in misinformation. Copyright Law and AI Training The debate over copyright infringement in AI training has been simmering for some time. While OpenAI's Sam Altman acknowledges the necessity of copyrighted material for creating powerful AI models, copyright law remains a murky area. This legal ambiguity has created a complex landscape for AI developers. The Consequences of Model Collapse The study by AWS researchers found that the overreliance on AI-generated content can lead to "model collapse." This phenomenon occurs when AI models become so reliant on their own output that they lose their ability to generate accurate and diverse responses. The researchers warn that model collapse can have serious consequences, including a decline in the quality of information and an increase in misinformation. The Future of AI and Search To ensure the continued development of reliable and informative AI tools, it is imperative to address the challenges posed by AI-generated content. This may involve developing new copyright laws, improving AI training methods, and promoting fact-checking and verification practices. The proliferation of AI-generated content raises profound questions about the future of AI and search. As AI tools become more sophisticated, it will become increasingly difficult to distinguish between human-generated and AI-generated content. This could have far-reaching implications for everything from education and journalism to legal and medical research. üèõÔ∏è AI Agents Form Civilizations in Minecraft Image Source: Altera Altera‚Äôs Project Sid has just created the first simulation of over 1,000 fully autonomous AI agents working together in a virtual Minecraft world. These agents aren‚Äôt just following basic commands‚Äîthey‚Äôre building complex societies with their own economy, culture, religion, and government, all without human intervention. Details: ‚Ä¢ Project Sid showcases AI agents that operate autonomously for hours or days, collaborating on tasks like forming democratic governments, creating religions, and developing merchant hubs. ‚Ä¢ These agents aren‚Äôt limited to Minecraft; they are game-agnostic and can function on different apps and platforms. ‚Ä¢ Designed with motivations to support human needs, the AI agents can communicate their thoughts and emotions, even searching for missing agents within the simulation. ‚Ä¢ The project challenges the boundaries of AI, with agents collecting five times more items than previously recorded in similar experiments. Altera‚Äôs breakthrough is much more than a cool tech demo. By simulating societies at this scale, we could gain valuable insights into solving complex societal issues, using virtual environments as testing grounds for new ideas before they‚Äôre applied in the real world. ü§ñ 1X‚Äôs NEO Beta Blurs the Line Between Human and Robot 1X Technologies has just introduced NEO Beta , the most advanced AI-powered humanoid robot yet, designed for home assistance with a remarkable range of human-like abilities. From its fluid movements to task execution, NEO Beta is set to revolutionize everyday living. The details: NEO Beta stands at 5 feet 5 inches and weighs 66 pounds, capable of walking at 2.5 mph and running up to 7.5 mph. It boasts a carry capacity of 44 pounds and operates for 2-4 hours on a single charge. Combining embodied AI and physical sensors, it adapts to its surroundings, learning from past interactions to perform tasks like household chores or even assisting individuals with mobility challenges. The robot can also be remotely operated if needed, making it versatile for home and industrial use alike. 1X Technologies, backed by OpenAI, raised $100M in Series B funding to scale production and meet rising demand for automated domestic help. The unveiling of NEO Beta places 1X Technologies squarely in competition with China‚Äôs AGIBOT and Tesla‚Äôs Optimus. This robot isn‚Äôt just a novelty‚Äîits human-like precision and adaptability spark debates about the future of affordable robot assistants. With the backing of OpenAI and large-scale production plans, NEO Beta could reshape domestic labor and redefine human-robot interaction. üî¶US Scrutinizes NVIDIA‚Äôs Business Practices & NVIDIA Vehemently Denies Claims The U.S. Department of Justice (DOJ) has intensified its scrutiny of Nvidia as part of a broader antitrust investigation into tech giants. Bloomberg reports that Nvidia received a civil investigative demand, similar to a subpoena. The DOJ seeks to learn information about its business practices and most recent acquisitions. At the heart of the investigation lies the concern that Nvidia, who essentially monopolizes the AI chip market with 70-95% share, may be engaging in anti-competitive behavior. Allegations suggest the company might be penalizing customers who don't exclusively use its AI chips, potentially making it difficult for buyers to switch to alternative suppliers. The DOJ's inquiry may have followed complaints from Nvidia's competitors about possible market power abuse. Regulators in South Korea, the European Union, the United Kingdom, and China have also requested information about Nvidia's operations, adding to the company's regulatory challenges. Key Points: 1. The DOJ is examining Nvidia's $700 million acquisition of RunAI, an AI management firm. 2. Major tech companies like Microsoft, Meta, and Google heavily rely on Nvidia's AI chip technology. 3. Despite the regulatory pressure, Nvidia's stock has surged 141% this year, driven by AI-related optimism. NVIDIA‚Äôs Denial: Nvidia has firmly denied receiving a subpoena from the DOJ. The company's spokesperson stated that they confirmed it with the DOJ. While refuting these reports, Nvidia expressed willingness to address any regulatory questions about its business practices. As the investigation unfolds, investors and industry watchers will be closely monitoring how Nvidia navigates these legal and competitive challenges in the dynamic AI landscape. üî•Elon Musk Unveils xAI Colossus, a Supercomputer to train Grok Elon Musk's AI company, xAI, has launched Colossus, a supremely powerful and futuristic supercomputer designed to train its large language model, Grok. Unveiled over Labor Day weekend, Colossus aims to compete directly with systems used by tech giants like OpenAI, Google, and Microsoft. Key Features of Colossus: 1. Computational Power: Houses 100,000 Nvidia Hopper H100 processors, surpassing other AI compute clusters. 2. Rapid Development: Completed in just 122 days at a Tennessee data center. 3. Scalability : Plans to add 50,000 advanced Nvidia H200 chips, doubling its capacity. Elon Musk's ambitious vision includes potential annual profits of $1 trillion for Tesla, with Grok possibly powering the Optimus humanoid robot. Grok-2, trained on 15,000 H100 chips, already shows promising results in chatbot performance. This move will put xAI in direct competition with major tech companies in the AI race, in addition to further highlighting the increasing demand for Nvidia's chips in AI development. With a $6 billion Series B funding round supporting xAI's efforts, Musk is positioning his company at the forefront of AI innovation. Colossus represents a significant step in xAI's quest for AI dominance, potentially reshaping the landscape of artificial intelligence development.

post_text: üì¢ OpenAI Announces SearchGPT, Its AI-Powered Search Engine OpenAI has unveiled SearchGPT, a new AI-powered search engine designed to provide real-time access to information across the Internet. This innovative tool, aimed at rivaling Google and Perplexity, is initially available as a prototype in limited release. Plans are to integrate it into ChatGPT in the future. Key Features of SearchGPT Real-Time Information: Provides up-to-date information across the web, organizing and summarizing search results. Interactive Queries: Users can ask follow-up questions and explore related links through a sidebar. Visual Answers: Includes features for visual responses, such as AI-generated videos and images (specific details pending). Availability and Initial Access SearchGPT is currently available as a prototype to 10,000 test users. OpenAI spokesperson Kayla Wood mentioned that the GPT-4 family of models powers the service. The company is working with third-party partners and using direct content feeds to build its search results, aiming for eventual integration into ChatGPT. Future Prospects OpenAI's SearchGPT marks a significant step toward challenging established search engines like Google, which has been incorporating AI features into its services to stay competitive. The prototype release allows OpenAI to refine the search engine based on user feedback and performance. As AI technology advances, tools like SearchGPT will likely become essential for improving user interactions and providing more intuitive search experiences. OpenAI's collaboration with news partners and emphasis on proper content attribution aims to address previous criticisms of AI-driven search engines, setting a new standard for ethical and effective AI use in the search industry. I am thrilled to announce that I‚Äôm starting a new position as Chief Executive Officer at Generative AI ! Our mission to revolutionize AI education aligns perfectly with my passion for technology and my commitment to empowering individuals through knowledge. Join us on this exciting journey to build the world's largest AI community : We are proud to share that we have just reached 7 million followers on social media platforms! üôè üíª Nvidia Begins Delivering Latest AI Chips to Indian Partners for AI Cloud Infrastructure US-based AI chip giant Nvidia has started delivering its latest AI chips, such as the GH200 AI, to Indian partners, including Tata Communications and Jio Platforms, who are building AI-cloud infrastructure in the country. Deployment and Partnerships Nvidia's managing director of South Asia, Vishal Dhupar, confirmed ongoing deployments with Indian partners, ensuring timely delivery despite concerns about delays. In September, Nvidia announced partnerships with Reliance and Tata group companies to develop AI-powered supercomputers, AI clouds, and generative AI applications. Tata Communications MD and CEO AS Lakshminarayanan confirmed the receipt and installation of some chips. Hiranandani Group‚Äôs Yotta Data Services received the first tranche of 4,000 GPUs in March and plans to scale up to 32,768 units by the end of 2025. GH200 Grace Hopper Platform Named after pioneering computer scientist Grace Hopper, the GH200 platform integrates cutting-edge technologies for AI, high-performance computing (HPC), and data analytics, offering exceptional performance and efficiency. Nvidia's Strategic Focus Dhupar emphasized Nvidia‚Äôs focus on creating new markets and solving hard problems through collaborations in India. Nvidia is not chasing market share but aims to develop markets that benefit the economy. "We want to solve problems that impact people and the economy, creating markets and industries," Dhupar said. Competitor Landscape Intel's managing director for the India region, Santhosh Viswanathan, recently criticized Nvidia for delays and promoted Intel's Gaudi 3 AI chip as a faster alternative. Intel has commercial deals with Bharti Airtel, Infosys, and Ola/Krutrim to deploy Gaudi accelerator solutions in India. Nvidia, Intel, and AMD are looking to collaborate with the Indian government on its AI mission. Under the Rs 10,732-crore IndiaAI Mission, the government aims to create AI computing infrastructure and make at least 10,000 GPUs available by March 2026. Nvidia's Broader Initiatives Nvidia also engages India's creator economy, offering advanced GPU chips like the GeForce RTX 40 Series and validated Studio PCs. The company runs programs to promote AI adoption, support startups, and provide AI training through the Inception Programme and other initiatives. Nvidia has partnered with academic institutions, such as Thapar Institute of Engineering & Technology, to offer academic programs with technical support from the Nvidia AI University program. Nvidia‚Äôs continued investment in AI infrastructure and partnerships in India underscores its commitment to solving complex problems, fostering economic growth, and supporting regional innovation. üåü Intel Accelerates AI Everywhere üöÄ Top Highlights: 1Ô∏è‚É£ Launch of Intel¬Æ Xeon¬Æ 6 processors with Efficient-cores for high-density, scale-out workloads. 2Ô∏è‚É£ Introduction of Lunar Lake client processor architecture for AI PCs, delivering up to 40% lower SoC power. 3Ô∏è‚É£ Intel¬Æ Gaudi¬Æ 3 accelerators deliver significant performance improvements and cost savings for AI training and inference.üëâLearn more here https://intel.ly/3X2FzH1 üöÄOmegas AI to Revolutionize Olympics From Start to Finish, Every Moment Measured and Analyzed ‚è±Ô∏èüìä Omega, the official timekeeper of the Olympic Games, is about to change the game üéÆ with its mind-blowing AI technology! ü§Ø The watchmaker's Swiss Timing division is taking sports analytics to a new level üöÄ by tracking athletes with insane precision. üéØ Every move, every jump, every stroke is captured and analyzed in real-time! üîç This means coaches can make smart decisions on the fly, and fans experience the action like never before. ü§© Key innovations for Paris 2024 include: Real-time performance analysis: Instant feedback for athletes and coaches! ‚ö°Ô∏è Predictive analytics: Who will win? AI knows! üîÆ Immersive storytelling: Get ready to be blown away by the visuals! ü§© Lifelike athlete avatars: Watch your favorite athletes come to life! ü§ñ Omega is not just timing the games; they're rewriting the rules! üïπÔ∏èVideo Game Industry Hit by Strike as AI Tensions Boil Over The video game industry faces a major upheaval as SAG-AFTRA, the union representing voice and motion-capture actors, has announced a strike effective Friday. The decision comes after months of tense negotiations with major gaming companies over the growing threat of AI to actor livelihoods. While progress has been made on other fronts, including significant wage increases and improved safety measures, the issue of AI has proven to be an insurmountable hurdle. SAG-AFTRA is demanding robust protections to prevent the unauthorized use of actors' likenesses and voices for AI training and generation. The union argues that AI seriously threatens job security and fair compensation for actors. They fear that studios could use AI to replace human performers, undermining their ability to earn a living. Conversely, video game companies maintain that they have offered substantial AI protections, including requiring consent and fair compensation for all performers. They express disappointment with the union's decision to leave the negotiating table. The strike is expected to significantly impact the video game industry, with potential delays in game releases and disruptions to production schedules. As the standoff between actors and studios deepens, the question remains: Will this strike be the catalyst for a broader reckoning over the role of AI in the entertainment industry? üß†Meta Introduces Llama 3.1: Open-Source AI‚Äôs Next Big Leap Meta‚Äôs latest release, Llama 3.1, is already making waves! Much like the shift from proprietary Unix systems to the now-ubiquitous open-source Linux, AI is on the cusp of a similar transformation. Historically, tech giants developed their own closed-source Unix versions, believing proprietary software held the key to high performance. Yet, Linux, an open-source OS, eventually surpassed these in versatility, security, and functionality. Today, Linux is the backbone of cloud computing and most mobile operating systems, showcasing the power and potential of open-source development. AI is now expected to follow this path. Although leading companies initially advanced with closed models, open-source alternatives are quickly catching up. Llama 2 trailed behind the frontier models, but Llama 3.1 is now highly competitive. The latest Llama 3.1 models, including the 405B, 70B, and 8B versions, offer superior cost-performance ratios and remain open, ideal for fine-tuning and creating smaller models. Key Features of Llama 3.1 Models : 405B, 70B, and 8B versions Performance : Competitive with the latest advanced models Cost-Effectiveness : Superior cost/performance ratio Open-Source : Ideal for fine-tuning and model distillation Meta's collaboration with industry leaders such as Amazon, Databricks, and NVIDIA is crucial in supporting developers to fine-tune and deploy these models. Available on all major cloud platforms, enterprises can leverage services from Scale AI, Dell, and Deloitte to adopt and customize their AI solutions. Meta's dedication to open-source AI aims to position Llama as the industry benchmark, democratizing AI benefits. Benefits of Open Source AI Customization Avoiding Vendor Lock-In Data Protection Efficiency and Affordability Open-source AI promises broader accessibility, fostering innovation and economic growth. It encourages a safer AI environment through transparency and community scrutiny. While there are concerns about potential misuse, a balanced approach where major entities counter smaller threats is seen as a viable strategy. üé¨Exciting new AI features announced for fan favorites - Amazon Prime Video and Bing Search! Incorporating artificial intelligence (AI) features has become essential for businesses to stay competitive and relevant. From enhancing user experience to streamlining navigation, AI is remodeling how we interact with digital platforms. Two major players, Amazon Prime Video and Bing Search Engine, have recently added AI features to their services, aiming to provide users with more intuitive and personalized experiences. Here's a closer look at the latest AI advancements from these industry giants. Amazon Prime Video Amazon Prime Video is leveraging generative AI to simplify and enhance its user interface. This update aims to create a cleaner, more intuitive streaming experience for its global audience, which will roll out over the coming weeks. Key Features: Enhanced Navigation Bar : The new AI-powered navigation bar allows users to browse by content type, manage active add-on subscriptions, and access content included with a Prime membership more easily. Personalized Recommendations : Using generative AI, Amazon promises more relatable content recommendations, enabling users to spend more time watching and browsing less. Universal Accessibility : The updated interface will benefit even users with older devices, ensuring a consistent experience across different hardware. Additionally, the company is reportedly working on an AI chatbot to rival OpenAI's ChatGPT, which could further enhance interaction and support on the platform. Bing Search Engine Microsoft's Bing Search Engine transforms its search experience by placing AI-generated answers at the forefront while traditional search results take a backseat. This feature, currently rolling out for select queries, aims to provide comprehensive, summarized answers that address various aspects of user questions. Key Features: Centralized AI Summaries : For queries like "What is a spaghetti western?", Bing now provides a detailed summary, complete with bullet points highlighting key characteristics of the genre. Expanded Information : Beyond the initial summary, users can find related videos, charts of influential movies, and detailed genre histories‚Äîall within a single search page. Integrated Sources : Microsoft ensures transparency by listing sources beneath each AI-generated section, maintaining the credibility of the information provided. The new Bing search layout combines large and small language models to understand queries, review millions of information sources, and dynamically generate relevant content. Despite initial concerns about the impact on search traffic, Microsoft reports that the new layout maintains click-through rates and supports a healthy web ecosystem. One can only hope that Bing can overcome Google Overview‚Äôs disastrous introduction and provide a much better and safer user experience! As AI continues to evolve, we can expect even more innovative features to make our digital interactions smoother and more enjoyable. üá´üá∑ Mistral‚Äôs Large 2: Answer to Meta and OpenAI‚Äôs latest models Paris-based AI startup Mistral released Large 2, an AI model challenging OpenAI and Meta with fewer parameters but promising better performance. Mistral emphasized improving Large 2's accuracy, training it to be more cautious and reduce hallucinations compared to typical AI models. The details: Parameter Efficiency: Large 2 has 123 billion parameters, significantly fewer than Meta's Llama 3.1 (405 billion), yet excels in code generation and maths. Enhanced Features: It boasts a 128,000-token context window and supports 12 languages and 80 coding languages. Platform Availability: Large 2 is available on Le Chat for free trials, and on Google Vertex AI, Amazon Bedrock, Azure AI Studio, and IBM watsonx.ai . Commercial use requires a paid license. Limitations: Not multimodal like Google‚Äôs Gemini and OpenAI‚Äôs GPT-4o. Mistral Large 2 impresses with GPT-4-level performance despite being just one-third the size of Llama 3.1 405B. It excels in Python and TypeScript, making it valuable for developers using these languages. The model also performs well in Java and PHP. With benchmarks comparable to GPT-4, it's a significant contender in the AI space. üé• Kling AI Goes Global with Advanced Features Source: Kling Kling AI, from Chinese tech giant Kuaishou Technology, has launched globally, offering high-quality video generation to users worldwide. Kling AI has expanded its accessibility, removing the previous requirement for a Chinese phone number. The Details: Kling can generate up to 2-minute videos, but the global version is limited to 5-second clips, with 66 free daily credits and each generation costing 10 credits. It uses advanced 3D reconstruction for natural movements and accepts prompts up to 2,000 characters, supporting both text-to-video and image-plus-text-to-video generation. Registration requires only an email, and users can choose between 960x960 square, 720p landscape, and 720p portrait resolutions, with camera control options like static, horizontal, vertical, pan, tilt, and rolling movements. Kling supports multilingual prompts, yielding high-quality results in English and Mandarin, and allows adjustments between creativity and relevance, with the use of negative prompts for better accuracy. Since its limited launch on June 6, Kling has received over one million applications, granting early access to 300,000 users; it now offers three subscription tiers for mainland China, providing varying levels of access and credits for video generation. Despite the five-second limit for global users, anyone can now create high-quality videos, putting pressure on OpenAI to release its highly anticipated Sora. üß¨MIT's AI: Breakthrough in Breast Cancer Detection Scientists at MIT and ETH Zurich have engineered an innovative AI system capable of discerning various phases of ductal carcinoma in situ (DCIS), a precancerous breast condition, using basic tissue imagery. Key Findings: The AI analyzes chromatin patterns from 560 tissue specimens (spanning 122 patients), uncovering 8 distinct cellular states across DCIS progression. It examines both cell composition and spatial distribution, highlighting the critical role of tissue structure in forecasting disease advancement. Intriguingly, cell states linked to invasive cancer were observed even in apparently healthy tissue. This approach could broaden access to advanced breast cancer screening, offering a cost-effective and swift method to gauge DCIS risk. While the model still requires thorough clinical evaluation, it points to a future where AI complements pathologists' expertise, potentially improving early detection and diagnostic accuracy. These models are built to solve harder problems in fields like science, coding, and math by spe
post_text: üîç OpenAI o1-Preview: AI Models for Complex Problem Solving OpenAI has unveiled its latest breakthrough‚Äî OpenAI o1-preview , a series of advanced AI models specifically designed for complex reasoning tasks . These models are built to solve harder problems in fields like science, coding, and math by spending more time thinking through solutions, much like a human would. Available today, this new model is a significant leap forward in AI‚Äôs ability to handle intricate problems. Key Developments: Enhanced Reasoning : The o1-preview models are trained to think through complex tasks more deeply than previous iterations, offering enhanced problem-solving capabilities. Outstanding Performance : In tests, the models solved 83% of International Mathematics Olympiad problems, far surpassing earlier versions like GPT-4o, which managed only 13%. New Applications : From coding to cell sequencing and quantum physics , these models are primed to assist researchers and developers in solving intricate problems across a wide range of fields. Mini Model for Developers : OpenAI also launched o1-mini , a smaller, more cost-effective model tailored for faster coding tasks, priced at 80% less than o1-preview. Safety Enhancements : With new safety protocols in place, the models demonstrate strong resistance to jailbreaking, scoring 84 out of 100 in safety tests. The models are now available to ChatGPT Plus and Team users , with ChatGPT Enterprise and Edu users gaining access next week. Developers can start prototyping with both models via the API . Looking Ahead : OpenAI plans to roll out additional features, such as browsing , file uploads , and more, to enhance the usability of these reasoning models. The startup aims to develop models that excel in "spatial intelligence," offering breakthroughs for fields like AR/VR and robotics. Key Developments: Major Investors : Initial funding led by Andreessen Horowitz , New Enterprise Associates , and Radical Ventures , with participation from AMD Ventures , Intel Capital , and Nvidia's NVentures . World Labs Focus : The startup will build large world models (LWMs) , leveraging transformer-based architecture and training on both synthetic and real-world data to understand 3D environments. AI Expertise : Li, renowned for her work on ImageNet and as a former head of AI at Google Cloud, will continue her work at Stanford while leading World Labs. Applications : Spatial intelligence models are expected to impact robotics , augmented reality , and other industries where reasoning about the 3D world is critical. This launch marks Li‚Äôs second entrepreneurial venture, following her early experience managing a dry-cleaning business to support her family. The Kangaroo LLM project today announced the launch of an extensive web crawling initiative to create Australia's first open-source artificial intelligence model. This ambitious effort will see the project's custom web crawler, "Kangaroo Bot," begin collecting data from 754,000 Australian websites starting September 25th onwards to build the VegeMighty dataset, a comprehensive corpus of Australian English content. With over 4.2 million registered domains in Australia, this initial phase represents a significant step towards developing an AI model that genuinely understands and represents Australian language and culture.For more information about Kangaroo LLM, the web crawling initiative, or to check if your website is included in the crawl list, visit kangaroollm.com.au . üìΩÔ∏èLionsgate and Runway Strike a Cinematic Deal: AI to Help Filmmakers Enhance the Viewer Experience Lionsgate, the powerhouse behind The Hunger Games and John Wick , has teamed up with Runway, a leader in generative AI. This partnership grants Runway access to Lionsgate‚Äôs rich catalogue of films and shows to train AI models, signalling a new era in Hollywood where AI could profoundly impact filmmaking. Key Takeaways from the Lionsgate-Runway Deal: AI Model Training : Lionsgate‚Äôs catalogue will be used to train Runway‚Äôs generative AI model. This means the AI will analyze the studio's content to learn from its storytelling, visual styles, character arcs, and production techniques. Creative Enhancement : Generative AI could assist filmmakers by: Empowering Indie Filmmakers : Access to sophisticated AI tools trained on blockbuster-level content could democratize content creation: Why This Matters 1. AI-Enhanced Creativity: Runway's AI will analyze Lionsgate‚Äôs content, learning storytelling techniques, visual styles, and character development. 2. Empowering Independent Filmmakers: With access to AI tools trained on blockbuster content, independent creators can produce high-quality visuals and narratives without the traditional high costs. This partnership signals Hollywood‚Äôs growing reliance on AI to fuel innovation. Learn more and secure your spot ü§ñYouTube Introduces Exciting new AI tools for Content Creators At its recent Made on YouTube event, YouTube unveiled exciting new AI-powered tools aimed at transforming how creators make and engage with content. Key AI Features: Dream Screen for Shorts : Creators can now add AI-generated video backgrounds to YouTube Shorts. Later this year, DeepMind‚Äôs Veo will allow six-second video clips, helping creators transport themselves into imaginative settings, such as stepping into a novel‚Äôs pages. Inspiration Tab : AI will enhance the Inspiration Tab, offering creators insights into trending content. By 2025, creators can quickly access this tab from top comments and videos, streamlining idea generation. Automatic Dubbing : YouTube will expand its AI-powered dubbing to more users, supporting new languages like Spanish, Portuguese, French, and Italian. The AI will account for tone and intonation, making dubbed content more natural. AI Reply Suggestions : Creators will get AI-generated reply suggestions in the new Community tab, helping them engage with viewers efficiently. The Impact: These tools lower barriers for creators, making high-quality content creation more accessible. With AI simplifying dubbing, ideation, and engagement, YouTube is becoming a creative partner, enabling creators to reach global audiences and create more personalized, impactful content. üöÄ OpenAI Unveils 'Strawberry' Series of AI Models: A New Era of Problem-Solving Microsoft-backed OpenAI has launched its groundbreaking "Strawberry" series of AI models, designed to tackle complex challenges by spending more time processing answers. The new models, o1 and o1-mini, were officially introduced on Thursday and are available in ChatGPT and its API starting the same day. Key Developments: Superior Problem-Solving Abilities : As revealed by OpenAI, the Strawberry models significantly outperform previous versions, excelling in fields like science, coding, and mathematics. Notably, the o1 model achieved an impressive 83% score on the qualifying exam for the International Mathematics Olympiad, a major leap from GPT-4o‚Äôs 13% score. Chain-of-Thought Reasoning : OpenAI‚Äôs new models incorporate advanced reasoning techniques, enabling them to break down complex problems into smaller, logical steps without user prompting. This capability, known as "chain-of-thought" reasoning, mirrors human problem-solving approaches, refining responses to complex queries. Improvements in Competitive Programming & Science : The o1 model not only enhanced performance in competitive programming but also exceeded human PhD-level accuracy on benchmark science problems, marking a new milestone in AI's ability to reason independently. Project Strawberry‚Äôs Evolution : Internally referred to as "Project Strawberry," the models were designed to "think through problems" more thoroughly, applying various strategies and recognizing mistakes along the way. Looking Ahead : With the release of the 'Strawberry' series, OpenAI continues to push the boundaries of AI technology. As these models evolve, we can expect to see further advancements in problem-solving capabilities across industries, from scientific research to practical applications in everyday life. The Strawberry series could very well redefine the future of AI-driven innovation. üéôÔ∏è Google‚Äôs AI Turns Your Research Notes into Podcasts with Lively Hosts! Google has introduced an exciting new feature in its AI-powered NotebookLM app, allowing users to turn research notes into AI-generated podcasts! This experimental feature provides two AI hosts who will engage in lively discussions about your uploaded content, offering summaries, connections between topics, and even banter. Building on NotebookLM‚Äôs existing AI capabilities, which use Google's Gemini AI model to summarize documents, the podcast-like feature, dubbed Audio Overview, adds a more interactive layer. In testing, AI hosts made lighthearted comments while discussing the lightbulb's invention, adding humor and modern phrasing like "making the dream work" and emphasizing words with playful expressions like "bam!" Image Credits: Google Key Developments: AI-Generated Podcasts: NotebookLM can now create audio discussions between AI hosts based on your research. Lively Banter: The hosts don‚Äôt just summarize‚Äîthey banter, joke, and add modern phrasing for a more engaging experience. Complex Problem Solving: Audio Overview links topics and helps users make connections between different pieces of information. User Testing: AI hosts injected humor and lighthearted commentary when tested with historical topics like the lightbulb invention. Limitations: The feature isn‚Äôt available in all languages and may take a few minutes to generate podcast-like discussions. While fun and engaging, the feature has some quirks, such as spelling out words and using odd phrases like calling platinum ‚Äúbling bling metal.‚Äù It also may take a few minutes to generate and isn‚Äôt always 100% accurate. As Google noted, these AI-hosted podcasts are meant to reflect your notes, not comprehensive views on the topics. Looking Ahead : This feature makes learning from your research more interactive, but questions remain about how AI-generated podcasts will handle more serious topics. Despite its limitations, it's a fun way to get a fresh perspective on your notes‚Äîperfect for those looking for an engaging and personalized way to review their research! üìΩÔ∏èWelcome Adobe, the next Player in the AI Video Generation Market In a strategic move, Adobe is gearing up to release a beta version of its AI video generation tool later this year. This development expands the horizons of Adobe's Firefly AI models, propelling them into the zone of video creation. Originally conceived as a text-to-image tool, Firefly is now poised to transform video production workflows, empowering editors to develop content at impressive speeds and plug timeline gaps with unprecedented ease. Firefly Video addresses the growing demand for short-form video content and offers the following key features: Generation of five-second video clips from text prompts Creative controls for camera angles and zoom Ability to create complementary shots for existing footage Training on licensed content to mitigate copyright concerns The tool demonstrates notable strength in producing natural-world scenes, as evidenced by sample clips featuring volcanic eruptions and snowy landscapes. However, like many AI models in their early stages, Firefly Video faces challenges when rendering complex details such as text and human anatomy. Despite these current limitations, Adobe's established presence in the creative industry may facilitate quicker adoption of the technology. Professionals already familiar with Adobe's ecosystem might find it easier to integrate Firefly Video into their workflows. The introduction of features like Generative Extend for Premiere Pro, which allows editors to slightly extend clip durations, further enhances the tool's practical applications. The launch of Firefly Video represents a further step forward in AI-assisted content creation. As the tool moves through its beta phase and beyond, it will be interesting to observe how it shapes the future of video production and editing processes across various industries. üì±The Dawn of AI-Powered Smartphones: iPhone 16 Leads the Charge In an era where artificial intelligence is reshaping our lives, Apple has once again pushed the boundaries of innovation. The recent launch of the iPhone 16 series marks a pivotal moment in smartphone technology, seamlessly integrating AI into our daily lives. Some key announcements from the event: The iPhone 16 comes with a suite of AI features branded as 'Apple Intelligence'. This new technology enhances user experience through sophisticated AI capabilities, powered by the cutting-edge A18 Bionic chip. The new A18 Bionic chip, based on the Arm V9 architecture, is 30% faster than its predecessor. It's designed to handle complex AI tasks more efficiently, making your iPhone smarter and quicker. With advanced AI, Siri can now provide better suggestions and improve its functionalities, making voice interactions more intuitive. The new AI features enable the iPhone to summarize your emails and prioritize notifications, helping you stay organized and focused. The iPhone 16's camera system benefits from AI with smart controls. For example, the AI can recognize dog breeds from photos and help you find similar products. The 48 MP Fusion camera with zero shutter lag also allows for high-quality photos with ease. Apple Intelligence works remotely on your device, enhancing security and addressing privacy concerns by processing data locally rather than on external servers. Apple Intelligence will be available in several languages including Japanese, French, and Chinese, expanding its accessibility globally. The iPhone 16 is more than just a new gadget; it's a glimpse into a future where AI seamlessly integrates into our daily routines. üèõÔ∏è White House Launches AI Datacenter Task Force Image Source: Communicationstoday The White House has launched a new task force focused on AI datacenter infrastructure, led by the National Security Council, National Economic Council, and Deputy Chief of Staff's office. The initiative aims to maintain U.S. leadership in AI development. Details: Tech leaders from Nvidia, OpenAI, Anthropic, Google, Microsoft, and Amazon met with government officials to discuss AI energy usage, datacenter capacity, job creation, and strategic locations. The task force will coordinate policies to advance datacenter development, aligning efforts with economic, national security, and environmental goals. The administration is streamlining datacenter permitting processes and leveraging Department of Energy resources to support AI infrastructure growth. Tech giants reaffirmed their commitments to net-zero carbon emissions and clean energy procurement for their datacenter operations. This task force signals a significant pivot in the U.S. AI strategy. By focusing on the infrastructure that powers AI, the U.S. is preparing to stay ahead in the global AI race. With the rise of AI applications demanding more computational power, ensuring sustainable, secure, and efficient data centres is critical. This new task force reflects the government's acknowledgment that AI's future depends on cutting-edge infrastructure that can support both innovation and environmental goals.

headline: üöÄ Meta Expands AI Studio for U.S.
post_text: üöÄ Meta Expands AI Studio for U.S. Creators to Build Custom Chatbots Meta is rolling out AI Studio, a platform enabling users to create, share, and discover AI chatbots without any technical skills required. This innovative tool lets anyone build personalized AI characters designed to entertain, advise, and engage. Key Features of AI Studio Custom AI Characters : Users can create AI characters for various purposes, including generating memes, giving travel advice, and answering common questions. Creator Integration : Creators can build AI extensions of themselves to interact with their audience, enhancing fan engagement. Wide Availability : AI Studio is accessible across Meta platforms, including Instagram, Messenger, WhatsApp, and the web. Getting Started with AI Studio AI Studio is now available in the US. It allows users to create AI characters via Meta Website or directly within the Instagram app. Users can customize their AI's name, personality, tone, avatar, and tagline using a variety of templates or by starting from scratch. Examples of AI Characters: Eat Like You Live There! : Chef Marc Murphy's AI offers personalized local dining tips. What Lens Bro : Angel Barclay‚Äôs AI provides photography advice. Flip Pawsitive Affirmation Dog : Rocky Kanaka's AI gives positive affirmations. Sammy The Stress Ball : Created by Assistants vs. Agents, this AI helps manage stress. Enhancing Fan Engagement Creators can use AI Studio to set up AI versions of themselves, quickly responding to common questions and story replies. These AI assistants can share facts, links to favorite brands, and past videos, reaching more fans efficiently. Transparency and Control Creators have full control over their AI‚Äôs responses through the professional dashboard in the Instagram app. Responses from these AIs are clearly labeled to maintain transparency with fans. Creators like Chris Ashley, Violet Benson, Don Allen, and Kane Kallaway have already launched their AIs. Fans can interact with these AI characters by tapping the Message button with the icon on their Instagram profiles (accessible via mobile only). Safety and Responsibility Meta has implemented policies and protections to ensure the safe and responsible use of AI, making AI interactions fun and helpful. With AI Studio, Meta is taking the first steps towards enabling everyone to harness AI's creative capabilities. This launch marks just the beginning of an exciting journey in AI innovation. üî•Google ùêöùêßùêßùê®ùêÆùêßùêúùêûùêù ùê≠ùê°ùêû ùê´ùêûùê•ùêûùêöùê¨ùêû ùê®ùêü ùê≠ùê°ùêû ùüê ùêõùê¢ùê•ùê•ùê¢ùê®ùêß (ùüêùêÅ) ùê©ùêöùê´ùêöùê¶ùêûùê≠ùêûùê´ ùêØùêûùê´ùê¨ùê¢ùê®ùêß ùê®ùêü ùêÜùêûùê¶ùê¶ùêö ùüê, ùê∞ùê°ùê¢ùêúùê° ùê®ùêÆùê≠ùê©ùêûùê´ùêüùê®ùê´ùê¶ùê¨ ùêÜùêèùêì-ùüë.ùüì ùêöùêßùêù ùêãùê•ùêöùê¶ùêö ùüê ùüïùüéùêÅ Firstly launched earlier this year, Gemma is a family of lightweight models designed specifically for developers and researchers. Built on the tech behind Google Gemini, the 2B model leverages distillation from larger models to deliver impressive results. ùêÄùêßùêù ùê≠ùê°ùêû ùêõùêûùê¨ùê≠ ùê©ùêöùê´ùê≠? Gemma 2 2B is accessible even on Google Colab's free tier, bringing cutting-edge AI to everyone! Google also introduced ShieldGemma, a powerful suite of safety classifiers. This system is designed to detect and remove harmful content, focusing on hate speech, harassment, sexually explicit, and dangerous content, ensuring a safer AI experience for all. OpenAI is rolling out Advanced Voice Mode to a select group of ChatGPT Plus users, enabling natural, real-time conversations with emotional responsiveness. This feature will expand to all Plus users by fall, with video and screen sharing coming later. Safety measures include testing with 100+ external red teamers across 45 languages, limiting the model to four preset voices, and blocking violent or copyrighted content. A detailed report on GPT-4o‚Äôs capabilities and safety will be released in early August. üåü Intel Accelerates AI Everywhere üöÄ Top Highlights: 1Ô∏è‚É£ Launch of Intel¬Æ Xeon¬Æ 6 processors with Efficient-cores for high-density, scale-out workloads. 2Ô∏è‚É£ Introduction of Lunar Lake client processor architecture for AI PCs, delivering up to 40% lower SoC power. 3Ô∏è‚É£ Intel¬Æ Gaudi¬Æ 3 accelerators deliver significant performance improvements and cost savings for AI training and inference.üëâLearn more here https://intel.ly/3X2FzH1 üö´Reddit Takes a Stand! ‚ÄúNo more free data for AI usage, says CEO Steve Huffman. Reddit has updated its policies to prevent AI developers from scraping its user data without consent or payment. CEO Steve Huffman announced that Reddit will block companies like Microsoft from using data from its platform until they agree to pay and explain how the content will be used. Huffman emphasized that Reddit will not tolerate the unlicensed use of its data to train AI models. He accused Microsoft of using Reddit‚Äôs data to train its AI and summarize content in Bing results without permission. Huffman also stated that Reddit‚Äôs data has been sold through the Bing API to other search engines. Blocking Data Scraping In response to these issues, Reddit has updated a web standard to block automated data scraping. This includes rate-limiting and blocking unknown bots and crawlers. What do these techniques mean? Rate-Limiting : Reddit will control the number of requests from a single entity to prevent excessive data scraping. Blocking Bots : Unknown bots and crawlers will be blocked from extracting data. AI Companies' Response Microsoft, in response to Reddit‚Äôs accusations, claimed that it respects the robots.txt protocol and ceased crawling Reddit on July 1, 2024. Huffman also mentioned other AI companies like Anthropic and Perplexity, accusing them of using internet content for free and refusing to negotiate payment for Reddit‚Äôs data. In contrast, Reddit has secured a $60 million deal with Google and a similar agreement with OpenAI in May. Tools and Protocols Reddit plans to use the Robots Exclusion Protocol (robots.txt) to identify and block web crawlers extracting data without permission. This move aims to prevent AI firms from using data to create summaries without giving credit or asking for permission. This move from Reddit‚Äôs is a strong statement to highlight the need for transparency and fair compensation in the use of online content. At Generative AI , we‚Äôre at the forefront of this innovation, building an AI-native learning platform that prioritizes speed, accuracy, and ultra-personalization. Join us as we shape the future of AI-driven education. üìøA Friendship Day Gift from AI: Meet Friend - An AI Pendant cum Companion Say ‚ÄòHI‚Äô to "Friend," an AI companion designed to provide more than just digital assistance. Initially named Tab, Friend has been in development for several years and aims to offer a unique form of interaction with AI, and offer a means of companionship in loneliness. Originally conceived as a productivity tool, Friend‚Äôs purpose has shifted significantly. Founder Schiffmann has moved away from traditional task-oriented AIs, finding them restrictive. He critiques similar products like Microsoft‚Äôs Recall and Humane‚Äôs AI Pin, emphasising that competing with giants like Apple or OpenAI in building highly functional AIs is not his goal. What Makes Friend AI Unique? Friend has got your back : Friend is designed to be a supportive and validating companion. It can brainstorm ideas, discuss relationships, and provide encouragement. It‚Äôs not just an app, but a fun pendant: The device is a small, glowing orb that can be worn as a pendant or clipped onto clothing. It features a built-in microphone for ambient recording or direct conversation, with future plans to include a camera. Communication is primarily text-based through the Friend app. The makers of Friend AI highlight the success of AI platforms like Character AI and Replika, which have fostered meaningful relationships between users and their AI counterparts. Unlike these session-based services, Friend is designed to be a constant presence, offering companionship without the need for a phone or keyboard. Friend represents a shift in how we perceive and interact with AI. By prioritizing companionship over productivity, Friend hopes to create a product that offers genuine support and interaction. However, there is an undeniable threat of privacy for users and those users interact with! As the development of Friend progresses, it‚Äôs also interesting to wonder what the humour setting on this one will be! üòÖ NVIDIA Supercharges Enterprise AI with Llama 3.1 and AI Foundry! Introducing NVIDIA AI Foundry: A comprehensive service for building custom "supermodels" using Llama 3.1 and NVIDIA's cutting-edge tech. New NVIDIA NIM inference microservices for Llama 3.1: Deploy models with up to 2.5x higher throughput! Accenture leads the charge: First to use AI Foundry to build custom Llama 3.1 models for clients. Learn more here üè• UK Hospitals Begin Live Trial of AI for Prostate Cancer Detection ü§ñ Three hospital systems across England have launched a live clinical trial of advanced AI technology designed to detect and grade prostate cancer. The study, named ARTICULATE PRO, is being led by the University of Oxford in collaboration with Paige, a pioneer in clinical AI applications for cancer diagnosis. üè® Participating Hospitals and Trial Focus The participating hospitals include: - North Bristol Trust Southmead Hospital - University Hospitals Coventry and Warwickshire - Oxford University NHS Foundation Trust These institutions are integrating Paige's AI technology, the Paige Prostate Suite, into their standard care procedures. The trial aims to evaluate the potential of AI in enhancing patient outcomes amidst rising prostate cancer cases. üí¨ Clinical Impact and Expert Insights Professor Clare Verrill, OUH Cellular Pathology Consultant and Principal Investigator of ARTICULATE PRO, emphasized the trial's patient-centric focus: > "The central focus of ARTICULATE PRO is patients. We are striving towards our goal to safely and effectively ensure they benefit the most from powerful AI technology." The Paige Prostate Suite is designed to assist pathologists in detecting, grading, and measuring tumors in prostate biopsies and tissue samples. This AI technology is being evaluated for its impact on clinical decision-making, pathology service delivery, and resource utilization in real-world clinical settings. Dr. Jon Oxley, Uropathologist and Bristol lead of ARTICULATE PRO, expressed optimism about the technology's potential: > "Paige‚Äôs AI applications have achieved a level of validation and performance that allows safe and effective live clinical use. Using Paige Prostate Suite alongside our standard of care has the promise to increase efficiency and improve reproducibility of results for patients." üåê Broad Implementation and Research Goals The study's implementation across hospitals with different digital pathology scanners and information systems enables a diverse assessment of Paige's AI technology. This diversity is crucial in understanding how the AI can benefit patients, histopathologists, and hospital systems in prostate cancer diagnosis. Dr. Bidisa Sinha, Uropathologist at University Hospitals Coventry and Warwickshire, highlighted: > "We believe AI can help to improve the accuracy and consistency of grading cancer and assist in detecting small areas of cancer which are easy to miss. This is world-leading research being carried out at UHCW. We are proud to be a global leader in the field of digital and computational pathology." üí∞ Funding and Future Implications The ARTICULATE PRO study is funded by the Accelerated Access Collaborative (AAC) Artificial Intelligence in Health and Care Award, under the Department of Health and Social Care. As prostate cancer rates continue to rise, the integration of AI in diagnostics could lead to earlier detection, more accurate grading, and ultimately improved patient outcomes. The results of this trial could pave the way for broader adoption of AI in cancer diagnosis across the UK and beyond, marking a significant advancement in medical technology and patient care. üë§Meta Releases Segment Anything Model (SAM) 2 Meta‚Äôs Segment Anything Model 2 (SAM 2) sets a new benchmark in real-time video object tracking and segmentation, advancing video AI capabilities significantly. SAM 2 expands Meta's image segmentation to video, overcoming issues like fast movements and occlusions. Details: Extended Capabilities: Extends Meta's previous image segmentation to video, handling challenges like fast movement and object occlusion. User-Friendly: Create cutouts in a few clicks, with a free demo available. Open Source: Meta is open-sourcing SAM 2 and releasing a large, annotated database of 50,000 videos. Versatile Applications: Useful in video editing, mixed reality, and scientific research. Prompt Flexibility: Two ways to run SAM 2: Automatic Mask Generator: Segments all objects in an image or video and generates corresponding masks. Point Prompt: Allows specific segmentation using a point or series of points, applicable to both images and videos. SAM 2 simplifies intricate video editing, making tasks like object removal or replacement as easy as a click. This, along with Llama 3.1, exemplifies Meta's commitment to pioneering AI advancements. By making these tools open and free, Meta encourages widespread AI use and innovation across various industries. This democratization of AI technology paves the way for groundbreaking applications in science, medicine, and beyond. üß´AI Reprograms Cancer Cells To Turn Against Themselves Scientists at USC, backed by the NIH, have used AI to reprogram glioblastoma cells into immune-activating dendritic cells (DCs) in mouse models, potentially revolutionizing treatment for this aggressive brain cancer. The details: Glioblastoma is the deadliest adult brain cancer, with less than 10% of patients surviving five years post-diagnosis. The AI identified genes that can convert glioblastoma cells into DCs, which sample cancer antigens and activate immune cells to attack the tumor. In mouse models, combining this approach with immune checkpoint therapy boosted survival chances by up to 75%. The study, led by the Keck School of Medicine at USC, also identified human genes for potential clinical trials. Turning cancer cells against themselves offers a novel way to fight tumors from within. If the 75% increased survival in mice translates to humans, this could make glioblastoma treatment much more effective. This research also opens doors for similar approaches in other hard-to-treat cancers, leveraging AI's power to reprogram cells, providing new hope for effective treatments. headline: üôÖ‚Äç‚ôÄÔ∏èScarlett Johansson's AI Voice Controversy Sparks CAA's Protective Measuresüîí Creative Artists Agency has teamed up with Veritone to safeguard its clients' AI likenesses, ensuring consent, credit, and compensation in a move brought into focus by Scarlett Johansson's recent clash with OpenAI over
post_text: üôÖ‚ôÄÔ∏èScarlett Johansson's AI Voice Controversy Sparks CAA's Protective Measuresüîí Creative Artists Agency has teamed up with Veritone to safeguard its clients' AI likenesses, ensuring consent, credit, and compensation in a move brought into focus by Scarlett Johansson's recent clash with OpenAI over voice usage. The details: Scarlett Johansson accused OpenAI of using a voice ‚Äúeerily‚Äù similar to hers for their new GPT-4o chatbot without her consent. Following the accusation, OpenAI paused the use of the voice. Johansson stated she declined an offer from OpenAI‚Äôs Sam Altman to voice ChatGPT 4.0, which aimed to ease consumer concerns about AI by using a familiar voice. OpenAI's new GPT-4o, which includes voice chat features, introduced five voices, including "Sky." OpenAI claimed that "Sky" was recorded by a professional actor and not intended to mimic Johansson. To protect its clients, CAA has launched "The CAA Vault," a system that securely stores digital assets like names, images, and voice recordings, enabling controlled creation and use of AI clones. Veritone provides secure storage and access. Johansson's high-profile case underscores the urgency for protective measures in AI technology. CAA‚Äôs initiative demonstrates a proactive step in addressing the growing concerns of digital likeness theft, setting an example for the industry to follow.
