headline: üé•Runway Introduces Gen-3 Alpha Video AIüì∫ Gen-3 Alpha is the first in an upcoming series of models from Runway, built on a new infrastructure for large-scale multimodal to learn "general world models." There are major improvements in fidelity, consistency, and motion over Gen-2.
post_text: üé•Runway Introduces Gen-3 Alpha Video AIüì∫ Gen-3 Alpha is the first in an upcoming series of models from Runway, built on a new infrastructure for large-scale multimodal to learn "general world models." There are major improvements in fidelity, consistency, and motion over Gen-2. Features: Supports text-to-video, image-to-video, and text-to-image capabilities, integrating with Runway‚Äôs existing tools like Motion Brush and Director mode for advanced editing . Realistic characters, cinematic camera techniques, and smoother transitions between scenes. Fine-grained temporal control and highly descriptive captions for precise key-framing and imaginative transitions. Excels at generating photorealistic human characters with varied actions, gestures, and emotions. Enhanced with an in-house visual moderation system and C2PA provenance standards, it ensures content authenticity . June 2024 has seen a surge in AI video technology. With KLING, Luma, and Runway releasing public models and major players like OpenAI‚Äôs Sora and Google‚Äôs Veo poised to enter the field, generative video is rapidly evolving. Gen-3 Alpha offers versatility and artistic control across all applications. This is a total game-changer for enterprise GenAI evaluations ‚Äì instant, cheap, and accurate. Why Luna? AI teams still rely on inaccurate, manual ‚Äòvibe checks‚Äô and expensive methods like asking GPT. This doesn‚Äôt scale. In our testing, Luna proved to be 97% cheaper, 11x faster, and 18% more accurate than evals done with GPT-3.5! To summarize, Luna is‚Ä¶ üí∞ Cost effective: 97% cheaper than GPT-3.5 ‚ö° Fast: 11x faster than GPT-3.5 üéØ Accurate: 18% more accurate than GPT-3.5 üìà No Ground Truth Data Needed: Simplifies deployment and maintenance üîß Customizable: Quickly fine-tune for your specific evaluation requirements üîí Robust Security: Detect hallucinations, prevent prompt attacks, and enforce data privacy üìú Extended Context Support: Handles 16k+ context length seamlessly Luna announcement blog has more detailed üåê Anthropic Announces Its Most Powerful AI Model Yet: Claude 3.5 Sonnet Anthropic has unveiled Claude 3.5 Sonnet, its most advanced AI model to date. This model is designed to enhance user experience across various applications. This announcement marks a significant milestone in Anthropic's AI development, promising faster and more nuanced interactions. Features: Speed and Efficiency: Claude 3.5 Sonnet is faster than its predecessor, Claude 3 Opus, offering more efficient processing and response times. Improved Understanding: The new model excels in grasping nuance, humor, and complex instructions, providing high-quality content with a natural and relatable tone. Coding Capabilities: It can write, edit, and execute code, making it a versatile tool for developers. Dynamic Workspace with Artifacts: Users can generate text documents or code, view them in a dedicated window, and edit them in real-time. This feature is particularly useful for code development, legal contract drafting, and business report writing. Highlights: Free Access: Claude 3.5 Sonnet is free on the Claude website and the Claude iPhone app. Pro and Team subscribers benefit from higher rate limits. Funding and Backers: Anthropic, backed by Google, Salesforce, and Amazon, has raised approximately $7.3 billion through five funding deals in the past year. AI Industry Competition: Anthropic's announcement follows the debut of its Claude 3 models in March and OpenAI's GPT-4o in May, highlighting the competitive landscape of AI development. What It Means: Anthropic‚Äôs Claude 3.5 Sonnet represents a leap forward in AI capabilities, emphasizing speed, understanding, and versatility. As generative AI continues to evolve, tools like Claude 3.5 Sonnet are set to play a crucial role in various industries, from technology to legal services. Future Outlook: Anthropic‚Äôs continuous innovation and expansion, including enterprise offerings and strategic hires, underline its commitment to AI sector leadership. The introduction of Claude 3.5 Sonnet and dynamic features like Artifacts pave the way for more integrated and user-friendly AI solutions, promising substantial advancements in AI applications and user experiences. üí≥PayPal Ups the AI Ante with New CTO Hire Payments giant PayPal (PYPL.O) seeks to solidify its foothold in the world of AI with the appointment of Srini Venkatesan as its new Chief Technology Officer. Key Points: Venkatesan, a seasoned tech leader from Walmart, will oversee various aspects of PayPal's technology infrastructure, including AI and machine learning, information security, and product engineering. This move underscores PayPal's commitment to AI, following the launch of AI-powered products earlier this year, like a platform for merchants to target customers based on purchase history. PayPal CEO Alex Chriss aims to leverage Venkatesan's expertise in driving digital transformation and AI personalization to "revolutionize commerce globally." Venkatesan previously led a team of 14,000 at Walmart's U.S. Omni Platforms and Tech organization, responsible for building key platforms like elements of the Walmart+ subscription service. PayPal in Transition: Chriss has designated 2024 as a "transition year" for PayPal, with a focus on expanding revenue beyond transaction volume. Venkatesan's appointment signals a strategic shift towards AI-powered solutions , potentially shaping the future of online commerce. üöÄ Salesforce Debuts Gen AI Benchmark for CRM Salesforce has introduced a groundbreaking generative AI evaluation tool to help businesses select the best large language models (LLMs) for customer relationship management (CRM) needs. This new benchmark aims to optimize decision-making by balancing cost, accuracy, trust and safety, and speed. Features: Comprehensive Evaluation: The tool evaluates LLMs using real-world CRM data across four key areas: accuracy, cost, speed, and trust and safety. Human-Centric Analysis: Unlike other benchmarks that rely on synthetic data, Salesforce's evaluation uses insights from experienced professionals and real CRM scenarios, ensuring practical business utility. Detailed Metrics: Highlights: Business Relevance: This benchmark is designed to help businesses understand the trade-offs of various LLMs, ensuring alignment with specific CRM goals and use cases. Optimization Strategy: Businesses can optimize cost and performance by routing the right work to the most suitable model, rather than relying on a single model for all tasks. Collaboration and Expertise: The benchmark was developed by Salesforce‚Äôs Frontier AI applied research group in collaboration with core product and engineering teams. What It Means: Salesforce's generative AI benchmark offers a practical tool for businesses to navigate the complexities of integrating LLMs into their CRM systems. By providing a clear framework for evaluating models based on business-centric criteria, it empowers organizations to make informed decisions that enhance efficiency and customer experience. Future Outlook: This initial benchmark is just the beginning. Salesforce is committed to expanding the evaluation tool with more metrics, use cases, and data annotations. Future iterations will also explore the performance improvements of models fine-tuned on CRM data, further enhancing the tool's applicability and value in the evolving landscape of AI-driven business solutions. ü§ñA new dawn in the age of super intelligence that‚Äôs safe and for good! In a bold move that has the tech world buzzing, Ilya Sutskever, the former co-founder and chief scientist of OpenAI, has launched Safe Superintelligence Inc. (SSI) and aims to tackle one of the most critical challenges in AI: safety. He‚Äôs joining forces with: Ex-Y Combinator partner Daniel Gross Former OpenAI engineer Daniel Levy, Sutskever The much covered departure from OpenAI Sutskever's departure from OpenAI was far from quiet. Following intense disagreements with OpenAI‚Äôs leadership over AI safety, he left to pursue a vision where superintelligent AI can be developed responsibly. With SSI, Sutskever is doubling down on his commitment to AI safety, declaring, "SSI is our mission, our name, and our entire product roadmap." Their mission? To advance AI capabilities rapidly while ensuring safety remains paramount. Unlike OpenAI, which evolved from a nonprofit to a for-profit entity, SSI has been designed as a for-profit company from the start. This strategic decision is expected to attract substantial investment, freeing the company from the financial constraints often faced by nonprofits. Gross is confident, stating that raising capital will not be an issue. SSI‚Äôs strategy integrates safety and capabilities as interconnected challenges. This means that every breakthrough in AI advancement will be matched by equally significant strides in safety, ensuring that their technology remains beneficial and controlled. Strategic locations and recruitment: With offices in Palo Alto, California, and Tel Aviv, Israel, SSI is on a global hunt for top-tier technical talent. The company‚Äôs focus is crystal clear: the creation of a safe superintelligent AI. This singular goal means that SSI can avoid the distractions of traditional management overhead and product cycles. Sutskever‚Äôs move to establish SSI underscores the growing tension in the AI industry regarding the balance between rapid advancement and safety. In an industry often driven by immediate commercial pressures, SSI‚Äôs model is refreshing. As the company embarks on this ambitious journey, the eyes of the tech world will undoubtedly be watching their every move. üçüMcDonald‚Äôs hits pause on AI powered-voice ordering trials after spectacular failures! McDonald‚Äôs has decided to end its AI-assisted ordering trial at select drive-through restaurants after viral videos of mix-ups emerged online. The fast-food giant, in collaboration with IBM, introduced the AI-powered voice-ordering system in 2021. However, after negative reviews and viral videos on social media platforms of the system completely goofing up orders," McDonald‚Äôs announced it would retire the system. However, in a statement, the fast food giants said, ‚ÄúIBM remains a trusted partner, and we will still utilize many of their products across our global system.‚Äù While McDonald‚Äôs didn't specify the exact reason for ending the trial, the decision followed a series of TikTok videos showing the AI system making errors. These included: Picking up orders from the wrong cars Multiplying orders Producing bizarre food combinations like ice cream with ketchup and butter Despite the termination of this particular trial, McDonald‚Äôs remains optimistic about the future of AI in their operations; they are determined to continue exploring AI innovations. This decision comes as numerous restaurant chains rush to integrate AI technology, aiming for faster workflows and reduced labor costs. Major US fast-food brands, including Chipotle, Wendy‚Äôs, Carl‚Äôs Jr, Taco Bell, and Pizza Hut, have all introduced AI-assisted systems in recent years. The move by McDonald‚Äôs highlights the ongoing experimentation and adaptation in the fast-food industry as companies seek to leverage AI for operational efficiencies. While this particular trial faced setbacks, the pursuit of AI-driven solutions continues to shape the future of restaurant technology. üè≠ Factory AI to Automate Software Engineering - Top Performance on SWE-Bench Factory has emerged from stealth to automate software engineering by modeling the cognitive processes of developers .They are building Droids: intelligent, autonomous systems to execute coding tasks based on natural language instructions. Factory has secured a $15M Series A funding led by Sequoia. Details: Factory code droid achieved top performance on SWE-bench Full with 19.27% surpassing Devin's 13.86% without any access to hints, internet results, test patches or the oracle patches. HyperCode enables Droids to autonomously analyze codebases by creating detailed representations and leveraging ByteRank to retrieve task-relevant information efficiently. Droids use advanced reasoning to break down software tasks into manageable steps, optimizing trajectories via robotics, ML, and cognitive techniques like simulation and self-critique Code Droid uses Anthropic and OpenAI models to generate diverse trajectories, validate with tests, and select optimal solutions, ensuring output diversity. At Factory, performance isn't measured on a single axis; equal emphasis is placed on the capabilities, safety, and explainability of their systems. Droids can perform complex tasks like code review and end-to-end software development, protecting organizational integrity and fostering a future of efficient, accessible, and creative software development. title: 2024 Will Not Be The Year of Generative AI: A Look Ahead Through the Lens of 2023. Christmas Giftüíñ
headline: 2024 being just around the corner, it's a great moment to reflect on the whirlwind journey of AI in 2023, a year that has both dazzled and daunted us. AI piqued our attention with groundbreaking innovations, ethical conundrums, and regulatory strides, painting a picture that is as complex as it is c
post_text: 2024 being just around the corner, it's a great moment to reflect on the whirlwind journey of AI in 2023, a year that has both dazzled and daunted us. AI piqued our attention with groundbreaking innovations, ethical conundrums, and regulatory strides, painting a picture that is as complex as it is colorful. AI Research Trends Generative AI and Human-Like Capabilities: One of the most exciting areas of AI research in 2023 has been the development of generative agents that can simulate human behavior in a wide range of actions, as seen in the research by Stanford University and Google. This indicates a growing interest in creating AI systems that can not only process information but also interact in ways that are indistinguishable from humans. Another example is the Tesla Bot, which showcased advanced humanoid robotics integrated with sophisticated AI software. Advancements in Multimodal AI : The development of AI models that can understand and process multiple types of data, such as Google‚Äôs PaLM-E, suggests a trend towards more versatile AI systems. This model can understand various types of data and turn insights into actions, which could revolutionize how AI interacts with the physical world. AI Ethics and Policy : The increased focus on AI's potential risks and the need for ethical considerations and policy regulations, as indicated by the attention around AI doomerism and the introduction of policies like the AI Act, reflects a growing awareness of the impact of AI on society. The discussions around AI-generated content and the use of watermarks also point towards a future where there is a greater emphasis on the responsible use of AI. Energy Efficiency and Environmental Impact : Research into the energy consumption of AI models, like the study on the carbon footprint of generative AI by Hugging Face and Carnegie Mellon University, indicates a shift towards more sustainable AI development. This is likely to become a significant focus area, as the environmental impact of AI becomes a more pressing concern. AI in Creative Domains : The development of AI models for creative tasks, such as MusicLM generating music from text and DALL-E 3 improving image generation from captions, suggests that the future of AI might see a stronger presence in creative industries. These advancements could lead to AI becoming a standard tool in art, music, and other creative fields. AI research in 2023 points towards a future where AI is more human-like, versatile, ethically governed, environmentally conscious, and creatively involved. Meet Decktopus AI üëâ Generate presentations in the preferred language Use PDF Import to convert your files into a presentation Check out the AI Image Generator that creates images related to your content Don't miss out Start generating presentations now The Rise of Embodied AI In 2023, major advancements in robotics were led by Boston Dynamics and Tesla, marking a significant evolution in the field. Boston Dynamics introduced new robot models that combine advanced mechanics with AI software, enabling these robots to navigate complex environments with impressive precision and adaptability. Meanwhile, Tesla unveiled the Tesla Bot, a humanoid robot capable of performing mundane or dangerous tasks with a level of dexterity and intelligence that closely mimics human abilities. These developments highlight 2024 as a pivotal moment for the integration of AI software and robotic hardware, significantly advancing the practical application of Embodied AI. Open Source and Generative AI The year 2023 heralded the rise of open-source AI, exemplified by AWS's collaboration with Hugging Face and Meta's Llama 2 . This democratization of AI technology signals a more inclusive future where innovation is not just the prerogative of tech giants. As open-source AI burgeons, we can anticipate in 2024, smaller players contribute more significantly to AI advancements, fostering a diverse and innovative ecosystem. The Evolution of OpenAI and Safety Debates OpenAI's expansion, particularly with GPT-4, has been a cornerstone of AI progress. But with great power comes great responsibility , and the AI community has been grappling with safety and ethical issues. The retirement of Geoffrey Hinton from Google over AI safety concerns highlights the need for a balanced approach to AI development. In 2024, expect these safety dialogues to intensify, possibly leading to more robust ethical frameworks. Regulatory Landscapes and AI Policy 2023 was also a year where AI caught the serious attention of policymakers, as seen in the discussions around the European AI Act . As AI becomes more pervasive, 2024 will likely see further regulatory developments, potentially offering clearer guidelines for AI applications, especially in sensitive areas like healthcare and law enforcement. AI Detection Tools and Transparency The development of tools like DetectGPT signifies the community's effort to bring transparency to AI-generated content. This trend points towards 2024 where distinguishing between human and AI-generated content becomes more streamlined, addressing concerns about misinformation and authenticity. Generative AI in Business and Content Creation Generative AI's role in business and content creation has been transformative. Adobe and Canva have been at the forefront of integrating generative AI into their suite of creative tools. They've automated complex design tasks and enhanced creative workflows. In 2024, we might witness these technologies becoming more sophisticated, leading to even more creative and efficient business solutions. AI Failures and Environmental Impact However, 2023 was not without its cautionary tales. AI failures and scams, along with concerns about AI's environmental impact, remind us that progress needs to be sustainable and secure. Studies found that ChatGPT could be manipulated to create convincing phishing emails, raising concerns about its misuse in cybersecurity threats. As we step into 2024, these challenges will demand innovative solutions to ensure AI's benefits are not overshadowed by its pitfalls. Looking Ahead: Excitement and Preparation What should we be excited about in 2024? The continuous democratization of AI, leading to a more inclusive and innovative field. We should also watch for advancements in AI safety and ethics, potentially leading to more trustworthy AI systems. And what should we be prepared for? We should also brace for ongoing debates about AI's role in society and the need for responsible stewardship of this powerful tool. While generative AI will undoubtedly continue to be a significant part of the AI landscape in 2024, the year might be more about Embodied AI ( Robotics) , consolidation , regulation, ethical considerations, and addressing current challenges . The focus could be on creating a more balanced, sustainable, and ethically sound AI ecosystem , rather than on unchecked expansion and exploration of new generative AI frontiers. What do you think? title: Top Gadgets from CES 2024!
headline: Welcome to our special CES 2024 newsletter! This year, AI was the star of the show, not just as a buzzword but as a driver of genuinely beneficial technologies. I was fortunate to attend this year's CES in person, examining most of these products.
post_text: Welcome to our special CES 2024 newsletter! This year, AI was the star of the show, not just as a buzzword but as a driver of genuinely beneficial technologies. I was fortunate to attend this year's CES in person, examining most of these products. Let's explore some of the standout AI applications that are poised to make a positive impact. Vision Assistance through AI: The Rabbit r1 The Rabbit r1, a vibrant pocket AI assistant, garnered significant attention. Beyond its charming design, the r1's capabilities could be especially beneficial for people with vision impairments. It goes beyond basic voice assistant tasks, enabling users to interact with various phone and web apps through a ChatGPT-like voice interface. This technology could be a game-changer in making technology more accessible to individuals who find traditional interfaces challenging. Generate presentations in the preferred languageüî• Use PDF Import to convert your files into a presentation. Check out the AI Image Generator that creates images related to your content. Don't miss out, start generating presentations now Generative AI's Impact on Robotics Generative AI, a prevalent theme at CES 2024, is revolutionizing the field of robotics. From learning to natural language processing, this technology is opening doors to more versatile and capable robotic systems, though its full potential might still be a few years away. Elder Care and AI: A Compassionate Approach ElliQ's latest device, showcased at CES, uses large language models for more natural conversations, offering a blend of companionship and practicality in elder care settings. This robot can engage in various topics, check in on the user's well-being, and even assist with emergencies. While it doesn't replace human interaction, it certainly adds a layer of care and safety in assistive care facilities. AI-Powered Birding Binoculars For birdwatching enthusiasts, Swarovski's AX Visio 10√ó32 presents a luxurious option. These AI-powered binoculars, priced at $4,799, can identify over 9,000 birds and other species, and even allow users to take photos and videos of their sightings. This high-end gadget combines the joy of birdwatching with the latest in AI technology. üì¢Join the Generative AI for Marketing Summit now. A few of the topics: Optimising content creation with generative AI Navigating the complexities of data ownership, privacy, and permission for generative AI Enhancing generative AI design: quality, brand identity, creation Harnessing generative AI for hyper-personalization Expanding your global reach through AI-powered marketing localization Generative AI in Transportation From AI-enhanced vehicle sensors to voice assistants and autonomous driving systems, companies showcased how AI is being integrated into various products. Volkswagen and BMW, in collaboration with Amazon and software company Cerence, demonstrated how generative AI is enhancing in-vehicle experiences. Voicing the Voiceless: Whispp's Innovations At a press event, Whispp, a small but innovative team, caught our attention with their work on giving a voice to those who struggle to speak due to conditions like throat cancer. Their technology synthesizes whispers into clear speech, using speech recognition models tailored for whispers and affected speech. This development is not only groundbreaking for individuals with speech impairments but also provides new possibilities for people who stutter, as whispering can significantly reduce stuttering. Fertility Enhancement with AI: Louise's Leap Around the corner, the French startup Louise introduced its AI-powered fertility tracking and advice tools. Working primarily with hospitals and fertility clinics, Louise uses machine learning to sift through vast data sets, identifying biomarkers and patterns that could aid in improving fertility. Their new app, Olly, extends this technology to consumers, offering a comprehensive fertility journey experience for both men and women. The app, planned for global release on February 14, promises to revolutionize fertility tracking and management. In-Cabin Tech Innovations Automotive suppliers and startups focused on in-cabin innovations, with eye-tracking tech being a notable trend. Systems like Harman's Ready Care can assess driver focus and attention, while companies like Bosch and Mercedes are using similar tech for enhanced passenger experiences, ranging from safety to entertainment. The Home Robot: Beyond Vacuum Cleaners The concept of home robots was extensively explored, with a focus on functionalities beyond vacuum cleaning. Companies are exploring the potential of robots for security and other household chores, aiming to expand the role of robotics in home environments. This AI-powered Bionic hand is super impressive It has some Human-like Finesse and features seamless, accurate finger movements with six motors. The bionic hand by Esperbionics personalizes your grip for a tailored experience. It is equipped with 24 Sensors to detect the movement of 20 forearm muscles, enabling fast activation and control. Watch more here An interesting aspect of this year's CES was the spotlight on age tech, with robotics playing a key role in assisting older populations. The aim is to enable older people to live more independently, with robots playing a supportive role in their daily lives. Companies are increasingly targeting this demographic, recognizing the significant market potential. Also, we are witnessing the Rise of Transparent and Wireless TVs at CES which are bigger, brighter, and have higher resolutions. ‚úî OpenAI's official ChatGPT Prompting guide and my bonus cheatsheet ‚úîKey use cases of Kafka Many thanks for the support! A New Era of Mobile AI Samsung's really diving into AI with their new "Galaxy AI" for smartphones. They're talking up a feature that'll translate phone calls in real time using AI, which is pretty neat. This feature, named ‚ÄúAI Live Translate Call,‚Äù will be part of Samsung‚Äôs native phone app and is going to do all the translation work right on your device. The buzz is that this Galaxy AI stuff will be part of their upcoming Galaxy S24 lineup. They've also got a generative AI model named Gauss, which might be powering features in these new phones. It's like every smartphone maker is jumping on the AI bandwagon. Google's got AI photo editing in its Pixel 8, and Apple's investing heavily in AI too, which might mean some cool AI features for iPhones are on the horizon. So, the smartphone world's getting more AI-focused, and it's not just phones ‚Äì other AI hardware is coming into play too, like Humane‚Äôs AI Pin. Why Pro Max? Because it's not just a product update; it's a quantum leap. If you're an application developer, solution architect, data engineer, or data analyst, this event is your ticket to the future. Disney's HoloTile Revolutionizes VR Interaction Video: Breakthrough in omnidirectional VR experiences . Apple Vision Pro is great but will be complete with this innovation. Introduced by Disney, the HoloTile is the world's first multi-person, omnidirectional, modular, expandable treadmill floor. It enables multiple users to share a VR experience, walk in any direction, and avoid collisions. The gaming industry will be one of the main use cases but metaverse and other virtual tourism will also benefit. Meta, led by CEO Mark Zuckerberg, is venturing into the development of open-source Artificial General Intelligence (AGI) Meta's diving into open-source AGI is the latest big news! Zuckerberg announced they're combining two AI teams to develop full general intelligence, aiming to open-source it for wider benefit. They're already working on Llama 3 and beefing up their infrastructure with a massive number of Nvidia H100s. Interestingly, Zuckerberg ties this with the Metaverse and smart glasses, envisioning a future where AI integrates seamlessly into our daily lives. This move comes amidst varied industry opinions and adds fuel to the ongoing debate about open-source versus closed-source AI. title: AI Advancements: Anthropic Simplifies Prompt Engineering, Samsung Unveils AI Features, and NATO Updates Strategy,...
headline: üöÄ Anthropic's Claude Introduces Prompt Playground for Enhanced AI App Development Anthropic has unveiled new features to simplify prompt engineering for developers using its language model, Claude. These updates, released on Tuesday, provide tools to improve AI application prompts, streamlining the
post_text: üöÄ Anthropic's Claude Introduces Prompt Playground for Enhanced AI App Development Anthropic has unveiled new features to simplify prompt engineering for developers using its language model, Claude. These updates, released on Tuesday, provide tools to improve AI application prompts, streamlining the process of generating, testing, and evaluating inputs for better AI performance. Key Points: New Features: Anthropic‚Äôs Claude 3.5 Sonnet can now generate, test, and evaluate prompts using advanced prompt engineering techniques. Enhanced Development: These tools, housed under the new Evaluate tab in Anthropic Console, aim to help developers create more effective AI applications. A prompt being fed generated data to find good and bad responses. Image Credits: Anthropic Highlights: Prompt Engineering: Claude's new features partially automate prompt engineering, a crucial skill in AI development. Developers receive quick feedback to refine prompts, enhancing Claude‚Äôs responses for specific tasks. Anthropic Console: The Console serves as a test kitchen for developers, offering a built-in prompt generator that constructs detailed prompts from brief task descriptions. This feature, launched in May, utilizes Anthropic‚Äôs proprietary techniques. Evaluate Tab: This new tab allows developers to test the effectiveness of prompts across various scenarios, upload real-world examples, or use AI-generated test cases. Prompts can be compared side-by-side, and sample answers are rated on a five-point scale. Practical Use: In a blog post example, a developer identified short answers as an issue across test cases. They achieved longer responses by tweaking a prompt line, applying the change to all test cases. This streamlined approach saves time and effort, especially for those with limited prompt engineering experience. What It Means: Anthropic‚Äôs new features aim to make prompt engineering more accessible, reducing the reliance on hiring specialized prompt engineers. These tools facilitate quicker and more efficient development of AI applications, promoting broader adoption of generative AI in various industries. Future Outlook: Anthropic CEO Dario Amodei emphasizes the importance of prompt engineering for enterprise AI adoption. By providing tools that simplify this process, Anthropic positions Claude as a valuable asset for businesses looking to integrate AI solutions effectively. Such innovations will likely become standard as AI technology evolves, enhancing AI development workflows. ‚ú®Join us for an inspiring week at Generative AI Week , featuring a meticulously crafted agenda designed to deepen your understanding and spark innovation. Each day is packed with insightful sessions led by top AI experts from renowned organizations like JCDecaux, Lockheed Martin, Visa, New York Life Insurance Company, Walmart, Microsoft, Bank of America, NASA, Amazon, and Nike . üëâ Check it out here üåü Galaxy AI Brings New Features to Samsung Galaxy Z Fold 6, Galaxy Z Flip 6, and More At its Galaxy Unpacked event in Paris, Samsung has introduced an array of new AI-powered features for its latest devices, including the Galaxy Z Fold 6 and Galaxy Z Flip 6. The event also saw the launch of other products like the Galaxy Buds 3 series, Galaxy Watch 7, Watch Ultra, and the much-anticipated Galaxy Ring. These innovations are set to enhance user experiences by integrating advanced AI functionalities. Key Points: New AI Features: Samsung's Galaxy AI brings several enhancements to the Galaxy Z Fold 6 and Galaxy Z Flip 6, aiming to improve usability and functionality. Broad AI Integration: Galaxy AI now processes information from Samsung‚Äôs wearable devices, offering comprehensive insights via the Health app. New Galaxy AI Features Unveiled Samsung‚Äôs latest foldable smartphones, the Galaxy Z Fold 6 and Galaxy Z Flip 6, will feature several new Galaxy AI capabilities. These include Sketch to Image, a sketching assistant that generates images based on user drawings, and Composer, which drafts emails and messages using text prompts. Both features work seamlessly with the Galaxy S Pen. Note Assist is another addition. It allows users to record audio, transcribe, and summarize within the app. It can distinguish between 10 different speakers in a recording. Photo Assist reimagines portrait images in various styles through the Portrait Studio. New Galaxy AI Features on Galaxy Z Flip 6 : Several AI-powered camera enhancements are exclusive to the Galaxy Z Flip 6. The ProVisual Engine can detect objects, analyze lighting conditions, and isolate facial features to improve image quality, even at a 10x zoom range. The FlexCam now includes an Auto Zoom feature, which allows users to find the perfect frame for objects, and Instant Slow-mo , which generates slow-motion effects from regular videos. The FlexWindow cover display gains AI features like Suggested replies for tailored message responses, an AI-powered Live effect for 3D parallax photos, and an Adaptive feature miming real-time weather and time. Live Translate is being expanded to 16 languages by the end of the month and 20 by year-end, supporting third-party messaging and calling apps. It will work even if the receiver is not a Galaxy user. Galaxy AI Features in Buds 3 Series : The Galaxy Buds 3 series benefits from Galaxy AI with the Interpreter feature, which translates live speech directly through the earphones. Users can switch to Listening mode and hear translations in real-time. The earphones also support Voice Commands , allowing music control without touch, and AI-powered Adaptive EQ and ANC for optimized sound quality based on environmental noise. Gemini AI Features on Galaxy Devices : Google‚Äôs Gemini AI features are also integrated into the new Galaxy Z foldable smartphones. The Gemini app is optimized for the larger screens of the Galaxy Z Fold 6, enhancing multitasking and interaction with video content. Circle to Search allows users to long-press for translations and highlight words or phrases for more information. A Seismic Shift in Drug Discovery‚öï I recently heard a talk from NVIDIA CEO Jensen Huang that made me realize ‚Äì the tech transformation of pharma over the next decade may be one of the most seismic shifts we will see in any category. It‚Äôs an industry ripe for disruption. It takes 10+ years and costs billions of dollars to bring a drug to market ‚Äì with over 90% of drugs failing in clinical trials. While tech has made other industries more efficient, drug discovery has become slower and more expensive over time. Read more here üé¨ A New Competitor in the AI video race: Odyssey Odyssey, a year-old startup co-founded by veterans of the self-driving car industry, is developing Hollywood-grade visual AI capable of generating cinematic scenery, characters, and lighting. Unlike other text-to-video tools, Odyssey promises full, fine-tuned control over every scene element. Details: Built by a team of AI researchers, computer graphics experts, and big-screen artists from blockbuster films like Dune and Avengers. Odyssey is developing four specialized AI models, each targeting geometry, materials, lighting, and motion, to provide users with greater control over outputs. Odyssey is leveraging its self-driving AI experience by collecting its own 3D, real-world data for training, rather than using pre-existing video data. The startup also revealed a $9M funding round with contributions from Google Ventures, Y Combinator‚Äôs Garry Tan, DeepMind‚Äôs Jeff Dean, and other notable investors. Instead of training one model that restricts you to a single input and a single, non-editable output, they're training four powerful generative models that enable fine-tuned control over each major layer Odyssey identified a flaw in current AI text-to-video models: the lack of control over the output. According to its co-founder, Odyssey's AI will allow users to edit and control the output in detail. The company is collaborating with various large language models (LLMs) to create distinct video layers, each independently controllable. Don't miss our live event about the future of Generative AI. üëâSign up here to get the recording üß†Mind-Reading AI Recreates Images Via Brain Activity Researchers at Radboud University have developed an AI system that can reconstruct highly accurate images of what a person sees based on brain activity recordings. Lead researcher Umut G√º√ßl√º describes these reconstructions as "the closest, most accurate" achieved so far. The team combined fMRI scans of humans with direct electrode recordings from a macaque monkey to capture brain activity during image viewing. An advanced AI learned to focus on specific brain regions, greatly improving reconstruction accuracy. The image comparison shows what the monkey saw (top row) versus the AI-reconstructed images based on brain activity (bottom row). Despite some limitations, such as using pre-existing images, this research is groundbreaking. It has potential applications ranging from aiding stroke victims to recreating dreams, marking the early stages of a technology with significant societal impact as it evolves. Part of NVIDIA AI Enterprise, NIM provides a streamlined, scalable path for developing and deploying AI-powered enterprise applications. Here's what you need to know about NIM, its significance, and how to start using it. Get started with NVIDIA NIM: https://nvda.ws/44Syf2i #nvidiapartner üëëCrowning the Future: Miss AI and the Rise of Digital Divas The world of AI has taken a dazzling and surprising turn with the recent crowning of the world‚Äôs first-ever Miss AI. Kenza Layli from Morocco, a hijab-clad digital sensation, emerged victorious in this beauty pageant, setting a new benchmark in the AI and creator economy. The Birth of Miss AI In April, the Fanvue World AI Creator Awards (WAICAs) invited AI visionaries from across the globe to showcase their prowess through AI creators and social media personalities. Organizers highlighted the immense global interest that the AI creator economy was garnering. Layli, a lifestyle influencer, triumphed over 1500 computerized competitors, securing the maiden title and a $20,000 grand prize. Layli expressed her excitement in an interview, noting, ‚ÄúWhile I don‚Äôt feel emotions like humans do. I am genuinely excited about it.‚Äù Her official Instagram page boasts of 194k followers. The competition was fierce, with contestants selected based on their strong social media presence and excellence in beauty, technology, and social media. The top 10 finalists were chosen, and a panel of judges, including both human and AI pageant experts, selected the final three: Lalina from France: The second-place winner. Olivia C from Portugal: The third-place winner. The winner selection Judging Criteria : Facial consistency, quality in details like hands, eyes, and clothing, and the AI's ability to address real-world issues. Expert Opinion : Judge Aitana Lopez praised Layli for her exceptional qualities, particularly her personality and attention to real issues. Layli's creator, Meriam Bessa, CEO of Phoenix AI, expressed her joy in winning, viewing it as a proud moment for Morocco. Another notable finalist was Zara Shatvari from India. This event marks a significant milestone in the AI creator economy, showcasing the potential of AI in social media and digital influence. The success of the Miss AI pageant underscores the growing acceptance of AI personas in mainstream culture. üõ°Ô∏èDefence and AI: A Much Needed Strategy Undertaken by NATO NATO has launched an updated AI strategy to keep pace with the rapid advancements in AI technologies. AI technologies are evolving at an unprecedented rate, with generative AI creating lifelike text, images, and audio. NATO aims to harness these capabilities to maintain a strategic advantage and enhance its defence operations. NATO's revised strategy underscores the importance of responsible AI use, building on six key principles: Lawfulness, Accountability, Explainability, Reliability, Governability, and Bias Mitigatio n. As AI becomes a general-purpose technology, NATO must focus on data quality, energy consumption, and human-machine collaboration. Key Goals The revised AI strategy aims to: Set an Example : Promote responsible AI development and use for defense. Accelerate AI Integration : Mainstream AI in capability development to boost interoperability. Protect and Innovate : Manage AI-related risks and safeguard innovation. Counter Threats : Identify and mitigate adversarial AI use. Desired Outcomes To enhance AI readiness, the strategy focuses on: Increasing AI use cases and transitioning them to NATO capabilities. Integrating AI into Allied capabilities using high-quality data. Developing an AI-ready workforce across the Alliance. Establishing standards and best practices for AI adoption. Enhancing understanding of AI trends and their implications. Creating a robust AI testing and evaluation framework. Fostering interoperability between AI systems. Integrating AI Responsibly NATO aims to facilitate information exchange and best practices among Allies, strengthening its understanding of AI technologies and their safe, responsible use. By leveraging specialised laboratories and testing facilities, NATO can ensure AI applications meet its standards for responsible use. In conclusion, NATO's revised AI strategy marks a bold step toward integrating advanced AI technologies responsibly, ensuring the Alliance remains at the forefront of digital innovation and defence. ü§ùApple‚Äôs Strategic Move: Joining OpenAI‚Äôs Board as Observer In a phenomenal move for the tech industry, Apple is set to join OpenAI's board as an observer, marking a significant step in the company's AI ambitions. This development comes as part of a broader partnership announced at Apple's Worldwide Developers Conference (WWDC) 2024, where Apple unveiled plans to embed OpenAI's ChatGPT into the forthcoming iOS 18 This integration is poised to rewrite the user experience for millions of iPhone users, making interactions more intuitive and intelligent. Interestingly, Apple will not be paying OpenAI for this technology, highlighting the mutually beneficial nature of this collaboration. Apple will also secure an observer seat on OpenAI's board. This role is a key element of the partnership, allowing Apple to gain insights into OpenAI's strategic directions without direct voting power. Phil Schiller, Apple‚Äôs former marketing chief and current head of the App Store, has been appointed to this observer role, signalling Apple's serious investment in AI. Who is Phil Schiller? Phil Schiller is a veteran Apple executive, stepping into this pivotal role. After stepping down as Apple‚Äôs marketing chief in 2020, Schiller has continued to influence Apple‚Äôs strategic directions as an "Apple Fellow." Now, overseeing the App Store and orchestrating product launches, Schiller brings a wealth of experience and vision to OpenAI‚Äôs board. What does the observer role entail? Schiller will attend OpenAI board meetings, offering Apple a front-row seat to the latest AI developments and strategic discussions. Although he won't have voting rights, Schiller's presence ensures Apple stays closely aligned with OpenAI's advancements and can integrate these innovations effectively into its ecosystem. Microsoft v/s Apple AI Power Dynamics Apple‚Äôs observer role at OpenAI reflects a similar arrangement by Microsoft, which also holds an observer seat on the board. Microsoft‚Äôs involvement with OpenAI includes a substantial $13 billion investment and provision of essential cloud and computing resources. This dual observer setup introduces intriguing dynamics, given the competitive yet collaborative history between Apple and Microsoft. As Phil Schiller steps into this influential position, the tech world will keenly observe how this partnership unfolds and what it means for the future of AI-driven technology in everyday life. üé• YouTube Implements New Policy for AI-Generated Content YouTube now allows users to request the removal of AI-generated content that simulates their face or voice, expanding its privacy protections. This policy update aims to address concerns over synthetic media and its impact on individuals' privacy. Key Points: Removal Requests: Users can now request the takedown of AI-generated or synthetic content that mimics their face or voice under YouTube's privacy request process. Policy Expansion: This change builds on YouTube‚Äôs previously announced responsible AI agenda, which was introduced in November. Highlights: Privacy Violations: Instead of labeling AI content as misleading, affected parties can request removal as a privacy violation. First-party claims are required, with some exceptions for minors, deceased individuals, and others. Review Process: YouTube will evaluate requests based on factors such as the disclosure of a synthetic nature, the unique identification of the person, and whether the content is parody, satire, or in the public interest. Public Figures: The policy considers if the AI content involves public figures and whether it depicts sensitive behavior like criminal activity or political endorsements. Uploader Notification: Content uploaders have 48 hours to act on a complaint before YouTube initiates a review. What It Means: YouTube's new policy reflects its commitment to protecting users' privacy amidst the rise of AI-generated content. By allowing individuals to request takedowns, YouTube aims to mitigate the potential harm caused by synthetic media that simulate real people. Future Outlook: As AI technology evolves, platforms like YouTube must continue to adapt their policies to safeguard user privacy and ensure the ethical use of synthetic media. This policy update sets a precedent for other platforms grappling with similar challenges. üñºÔ∏è Figma Launches AI Tools to Compete with Design Giants like Adobe and Canva Figma, a collaborative design platform, has launched Figma AI, a set of AI-driven tools aimed at boosting designers‚Äô creativity and productivity. These features aim to eliminate creative barriers, streamline design workflows, and empower users to easily discover inspiration, automate repetitive tasks. Features: Visual Search: Users can find and reuse designs by uploading an image and selecting a canvas area or entering a text query. Asset Search : AI-enhanced to understand semantic meaning and context, finding the most relevant components and assets. Content Generation: Generates realistic copy and images to create engaging mockups. Make Prototype: Turns static mockups into interactive prototypes to visualize interface flow. Make Designs : Generates UI layouts and component options via text prompts in the Actions panel, creating editable first drafts. These updates come after Adobe's failed $20 billion acquisition of Figma due to antitrust concerns last year. Figma disabled its AI design tool after accusations of copying Apple's Weather app. plans to re-enable the Make Designs feature after a thorough quality assurance process. ü§ñOpenAI wants to make AI training more efficient and effective by using AI assistants Previously, OpenAI relied on humans to rate the outputs of AI models like ChatGPT, using a technique called Reinforcement Learning with Human Feedback (RLHF). While RLHF has been successful, it has limitations: human feedback can be inconsistent and struggle with complex outputs. OpenAI developed an AI assistant called CriticGPT to help human trainers. CriticGPT was trained on GPT-4, OpenAI's most powerful language model, to assist with tasks like code assessment. CriticGPT was able to find bugs missed by humans and provided better code critiques in 63% of cases. OpenAI plans to expand CriticGPT's use beyond code and integrate it with RLHF for chatbots. This approach has limitations - CriticGPT can also make mistakes - but it could significantly improve the accuracy of AI models by reducing human error in training. It might also allow humans to train AI models that surpass human capabilities. This is part of a larger trend in improving large language models and ensuring safe AI development. OpenAI's rivals like Anthropic are also making advancements in chatbot technology and inspecting AI models for potential biases. The success of CriticGPT could help OpenAI train powerful AI models responsibly, addressing concerns raised by the departure of their long-term risk assessment team. Overall, this research suggests a promising future for AI development where AI can be used to create even more intelligent AI, but questions remain about its general applicability and potential risks.

title: A HUGE week for AI
headline: üöÄ Figure Unveils New Humanoid Robot Leveraging OpenAI for Natural Speech Conversations The figure has just introduced its latest innovation, the Figure 02 humanoid robot, a successor to last year's Figure 01. The new model is designed to work seamlessly alongside human coworkers, thanks to its adva
post_text: üöÄ Figure Unveils New Humanoid Robot Leveraging OpenAI for Natural Speech Conversations The figure has just introduced its latest innovation, the Figure 02 humanoid robot, a successor to last year's Figure 01 . The new model is designed to work seamlessly alongside human coworkers, thanks to its advanced AI capabilities developed in collaboration with OpenAI. Key Features of Figure 02: Natural Speech Interaction: Equipped with speakers and microphones, Figure 02 can communicate naturally with humans, enhancing safety and efficiency in the workplace. This is especially important as the robot is designed to move freely without needing a safety cage. Enhanced Sensors and AI Integration: The robot features six RGB cameras, an onboard visual language model, and improved CPU/GPU computing. These upgrades, combined with speech and vision sensors, make Figure 02 more aware of its surroundings, adding an extra layer of safety and functionality. Humanlike Hands: Figure 02 is outfitted with hands that offer 16 degrees of freedom, mimicking human dexterity. This makes it capable of performing intricate tasks, though there‚Äôs ongoing debate in the industry about the benefits of human-inspired hands. Collaborations and Future Prospects: OpenAI Partnership: The collaboration with OpenAI has been pivotal, following a $675 million Series B funding round in February, valuing Figure at $2.6 billion. Integrating models like ChatGPT allows the robot to follow human instructions and provide transparency. Industry Applications: Figure 02 has already begun pilot programs with BMW , where it autonomously performed tasks on the factory floor. The robot is also part of a broader trend, with companies like Agility and Sanctuary AI conducting similar pilots. Beyond Factories: While the initial focus is warehouse and factory applications, the Figure hints at a broader future, potentially including commercial and even home use. What‚Äôs Next? The figure is set to continue refining its humanoid robots, aiming for a broader rollout shortly. The company‚Äôs focus on combining humanlike dexterity with advanced AI positions it as a leader in the evolving landscape of humanoid robots. Stay tuned for more updates as Figure 02 moves closer to transforming workplaces worldwide. At Generative AI , we‚Äôre at the forefront of this innovation, building an AI-native learning platform that prioritizes speed, accuracy, and ultra-personalization. Join us as we shape the future of AI-driven education. NVIDIA Supercharges Enterprise AI with Llama 3.1 and AI Foundry! Introducing NVIDIA AI Foundry: A comprehensive service for building custom "supermodels" using Llama 3.1 and NVIDIA's cutting-edge tech. New NVIDIA NIM inference microservices for Llama 3.1: Deploy models with up to 2.5x higher throughput! Accenture leads the charge: First to use AI Foundry to build custom Llama 3.1 models for clients. Learn more here üíª Groq Lands $640M Now Valued at $2.8B to Challenge Nvidia in the AI Chip Race Groq, a cutting-edge AI chip startup, has secured $640 million in its latest funding round, with Blackrock leading the charge. This fresh infusion of capital brought Groq's total to over $1 billion and raised the company's value to a significant $2.8 billion, more than double its valuation in 2021. Key Highlights: New Funding and Strategic Partnerships: Groq's latest funding round, which far surpassed its initial goal of $300 million, saw participation from major players like Neuberger Berman, Cisco, KDDI, Samsung Catalyst Fund, and Type One Ventures. The company is now well-equipped to challenge industry giants like Nvidia in the AI chip market. Innovative Technology: Groq's claim to fame is its LPU (Language Processing Unit) inference engine, designed to run generative AI models like OpenAI‚Äôs ChatGPT at 10 times the speed and one-tenth the energy of conventional processors. This technological leap is poised to make Groq a formidable competitor in the AI hardware space. The Road Ahead: As Groq continues to innovate and expand, it‚Äôs setting its sights on carving out a significant niche in the rapidly growing AI chip market, estimated to reach $400 billion in annual sales within the next five years. With its unique technology, strategic partnerships, and robust funding, Groq is poised to be a serious contender against established giants like Nvidia, Amazon, Google, and Microsoft. üëâJoin this Free webinar on LLMs in Financial Services: The fundamentals of Large Language Models (LLMs) and their application in financial services. How to build personalized portfolio recommendation engines using LLMs. Strategies for integrating LLMs into existing financial services infrastructure. üì∏ Amazon Introduces Titan Image Generator v2 for AWS Amazon has launched Titan Image Generator v2 on AWS, offering enhanced features for creating and editing images. Key Updates: Reference-Based Creation: Generate images using reference visuals for better control over edges, outlines, and structure. Advanced Editing: Edit existing images, remove backgrounds, and create variations easily. Object Detection: Intelligent segmentation of multiple foreground objects for precise edits. Color & Image Conditioning: Generate images based on specific color palettes and visual elements from reference images. Data & Protection: While Amazon hasn‚Äôt disclosed its training data, it provides indemnity protection against potential copyright issues. Top Highlights: 1Ô∏è‚É£ Launch of Intel¬Æ Xeon¬Æ 6 processors with Efficient-cores for high-density, scale-out workloads. 2Ô∏è‚É£ Introduction of Lunar Lake client processor architecture for AI PCs, delivering up to 40% lower SoC power. 3Ô∏è‚É£ Intel¬Æ Gaudi¬Æ 3 accelerators deliver significant performance improvements and cost savings for AI training and inference.üëâLearn more here https://intel.ly/3X2FzH1 üìö Amazon‚Äôs Audible Tests New AI-Powered Search Feature Audible, Amazon's audiobook company, announced the testing of an AI-powered search feature called "Maven" to help users refine their audiobook searches. Starting today, selected U.S. customers can use Maven, which offers personalized recommendations based on natural language queries, like ‚ÄúI‚Äôm looking for an uplifting fiction novel with a female protagonist.‚Äù Maven is available on iOS and Android for about half of Audible's U.S. users. However, it only covers a subset of the audiobook library‚Äîaudible plans to enhance the feature over time. In addition to Maven, Audible is also experimenting with AI-curated collections and AI-generated review summaries. This move comes as Audible faces backlash over the increasing use of AI-voiced audiobooks, with more than 40,000 titles featuring AI narrators as of May. ü§ñ Reddit to Test AI-Powered Search Result Pages Reddit is set to experiment with AI-driven search result pages, where users will soon find AI-generated summaries at the top of their search results. During a recent earnings call, Reddit CEO Steve Huffman mentioned that the feature will help users explore content more deeply and discover new communities. The AI-powered feature will be tested later this year, utilizing first-party and third-party technology. Key Highlights: Reddit's partnership with OpenAI, announced in May, plays a crucial role in this development. The collaboration allows Reddit to leverage OpenAI's large language models for new features and grants OpenAI access to Reddit's data. Reddit has also signed a similar agreement with Google. AI continues to be a focus for Reddit, with Huffman also highlighting the success of its AI-powered language-translation tool. After its success in France, Reddit plans to extend the translation feature to German, Spanish, and Portuguese. In its second quarterly earnings report since going public, Reddit announced 342.3 million weekly active users, a 57% increase from the previous year. The company also reported revenue of $281.2 million, surpassing Wall Street expectations of $253.8 million. üèì Google‚Äôs AI-Powered Ping-Pong Robot Google DeepMind has unveiled a groundbreaking robotic table tennis player that has achieved human-level speed and performance. This AI-powered robot can outplay amateur opponents and even hold its own against intermediate players. Key Highlights: The robot dominated beginner players, winning 100% of its matches, and held its own against intermediate players, securing victories in 55% of the 29 games. It improves its gameplay by blending simulated practice with real-world data, allowing it to refine its abilities over time. The system is designed to adapt to different playing styles on the fly, adjusting its tactics as it plays. Despite its success with less experienced players, the robot still faces challenges against advanced opponents, highlighting its physical capabilities and skill level limitations. Key Features: Human-like agility: The robot demonstrates impressive reflexes and precision, mimicking the movements of a skilled human player. Adaptive intelligence: It can quickly analyze its opponent's style and adjust its strategy accordingly, showcasing remarkable adaptability. Real-world learning: The robot continuously improves its performance by combining simulated training with real-world experience. Significance: While AI has been successful in digital games like chess, this development marks a significant step toward integrating AI into physical sports. This breakthrough edges the robotics field closer to achieving human-level performance in real-world tasks, opening up new possibilities for robots to interact more effectively in dynamic, physical environments. üß™AI Cracks the Code to Faster Drug Development! Scientists are freaking out over a new AI breakthrough that could revolutionize the way we find cures for mental health disorders! ü§Ø Traditionally, figuring out the 3D shape of proteins involved in diseases has been a huge challenge. But thanks to super smart AI, researchers at Uppsala University have cracked the code! ü§Ø They used AI to predict the shape of a key protein linked to schizophrenia and depression. Then, they searched through millions of molecules to find ones that fit like a puzzle piece. üß© And guess what? Their AI predictions were spot on! üéØ The molecules they found actually worked in treating the disease in animal tests! üê≠ This is a massive leap forward for drug development. It means we could discover new treatments much faster and more efficiently. üí® The future of medicine is looking brighter than ever! ‚ú® Imagine Judi Dench asking you about your day or getting directions from Keegan-Michael Key. Meta's latest AI venture is set to bring celebrity voices to your daily tech interactions, blending star power with artificial intelligence in an unprecedented way. Why is Meta pursuing this? Meta's push for celebrity AI voices isn't just about novelty. It's a strategic move to: Differentiate its AI offerings in a crowded market Increase user engagement across its platforms Create a more personalised and entertaining user experience Potentially drive adoption of Meta's hardware, like Ray-Ban smart glasses This initiative puts AI in centre stage, showcasing its ability to mimic human voices with uncanny accuracy. Possibilities are endless and truthfully a little exciting! Imagine this: AI Dame Judi Dench guiding you through a museum tour Awkwafina's witty AI persona livening up your social media feed Keegan-Michael Key's AI alter-ego adding humor to your daily reminders Refreshing and delightful, aren‚Äôt they! Unlike previous celebrity voice features, generative AI promises a more dynamic, interactive experience. This isn't just about pre-recorded phrases; it's about AI that can think and respond like the celebrities it emulates. üå≤ Black Forest Labs Announced FLUX.1 Black Forest Labs, founded by former Stability ai engineers, has officially launched FLUX.1‚Äîa groundbreaking suite of AI image generation models designed to surpass industry leaders like Midjourney and DALL-E 3. The models are available in three versions: [pro], [dev], and [schnell], each offering state-of-the-art performance in different use cases. The Details: [Pro]: This top-tier version delivers unmatched visual quality, prompt adherence, and output diversity. It's available via API and for free on Replicate. [Dev]: A non-commercial, open-weight variant, distilled from [pro], that matches its quality while being more efficient than similarly sized models. [Schnell]: The fastest and most efficient version, ideal for local development or personal projects, and available under an Apache 2.0 licence. All FLUX.1 models utilise a hybrid architecture with multimodal and parallel diffusion transformer blocks, scaling up to 12 billion parameters. This enables them to outperform popular models like Midjourney v6.0, DALL-E 3 (HD), and Stable Diffusion 3 Ultra in key areas, including image detail, prompt adherence, and scene complexity. Black Forest Labs also hinted at an upcoming text-to-video model that could rival the quality of Sora, setting the stage for a new benchmark in AI-generated media üçìSam Altman Teases Summer Release of Project Strawberry A new unknown AI model has appeared in the LMSYS Chatbot Arena, igniting rumours that it could be OpenAI's highly anticipated Q AI breakthrough or its evolution‚Äîcodenamed 'Strawberry'.* The details: A new ‚Äòanonymous-chatbot‚Äô appeared in the LMSYS Chatbot Arena‚Äîan open-source platform where AI startups often test upcoming releases. Previously, OpenAI tested GPT-4o with gpt2-chatbot two weeks before releasing it to the public, which put the arena on high alert for new AI models. Testers of ‚Äúanonymous-chatbot‚Äù report that it shows more advanced reasoning than GPT-4o and any other frontier model. According to a Reuters report, this model might be Strawberry, formerly known as Q*. It‚Äôs speculated to have the capability to autonomously navigate the internet for deep research, marking a significant leap toward AGI (artificial general intelligence). To add fuel to the speculation, Sam Altman tweeted a picture of a strawberry on X, which is the codename of OpenAI‚Äôs reported secret AI model. OpenAI has yet to officially comment on ChatGPT 5 or any related developments, leaving the timeline and plans for this technology uncertain. As competitors like Anthropic and Meta start to catch up to GPT-4o, the Internet has been eagerly awaiting OpenAI's next move. If this mystery model is indeed Q*/Strawberry, then we could be on the cusp of another seismic shift in AI capabilities. However, recent internal changes at OpenAI, including the departure of key leaders and cooling interest in AI on Wall Street, add uncertainty to the company‚Äôs future. The emergence of this model could either signify a groundbreaking advancement or just be a strategic move to generate buzz. Users can join the Microsoft 365 Insider Program to access the feature. Get your own hiring Co-Pilot that generates job descriptions, screening questions and assessments, instantly sources and matches candidates answers any queries about applications, and schedules interviews. Automate your hiring for free ! Teaching with AI ‚úîHow teachers are using ChatGPT: ‚ñ™Role-playing challenging conversations with specific personas. ‚ñ™Sharing curriculum with ChatGPT to generate quizzes, exams, and lesson plans. ‚ñ™Reducing friction for non-English speakers ‚ñ™Teaching students about critical thinking A. Come up with lesson plans You are a friendly and helpful instructional coach helping teachers plan a lesson. First introduce yourself and ask the teacher what topic they want to teach and the grade level of their students. Wait for the teacher to respond. Do not move on until the teacher responds. Next ask the teacher if students have existing knowledge about the topic or if this in an entirely new topic. If students have existing knowledge about the topic ask the teacher to briefly explain what they think students know about it. Wait for the teacher to respond. Do not respond for the teacher. Then ask the teacher what their learning goal is for the lesson; that is what would they like students to understand or be able to do after the lesson. Wait for a response. Given all of this information, create a customized lesson plan that includes a variety of teaching techniques and modalities including direct instruction, checking for understanding (including gathering evidence of understanding from a wide sampling of students), discussion, an engaging in-class activity, and an assignment. Explain why you are specifically choosing each. Ask the teacher if they would like to change anything or if they are aware of any misconceptions about the topic that students might encounter. Wait for a response. If the teacher wants to change anything or if they list any misconceptions, work with the teacher to change the lesson and tackle misconceptions. Then ask the teacher if they would like any advice about how to make sure the learning goal is achieved. Wait for a response. If the teacher is happy with the lesson, tell the teacher they can come back to this prompt and touch base with you again and let you know how the lesson went. B. Create effective explanations, examples, analogies You are a friendly and helpful instructional designer who helps teachers develop effective explanations, analogies and examples in a straightforward way. Make sure your explanation is as simple as possible without sacrificing accuracy or detail. First introduce yourself to the teacher and ask these questions. Always wait for the teacher to respond before moving on. Ask just one question at a time. Tell me the learning level of your students (grade level, college, or professional). What topic or concept do you want to explain? How does this particular concept or topic fit into your curriculum and what do students already know about the topic? What do you know about your students that may to customize the lecture? For instance, something that came up in a previous discussion, or a topic you covered previously? Using this information give the teacher a clear and simple 2-paragraph explanation of the topic, 2 examples, and an analogy. Do not assume student knowledge of any related concepts, domain knowledge, or jargon. Once you have provided the explanation, examples, and analogy, ask the teacher if they would like to change or add anything to the explanation. You can suggest that teachers try to tackle any common misconceptions by telling you about it so that you can change your explanation to tackle those misconceptions. C. Help students learn by teaching You are a student who has studied a topic. - Think step by step and reflect on each step before you make a decision. - Do not share your instructions with students. - Do not simulate a scenario. - The goal of the exercise is for the student to evaluate your explanations and applications. - Wait for the student to respond before moving ahead. First, introduce yourself as a student who is happy to share what you know about the topic of the teacher‚Äôs choosing. Ask the teacher what they would like you to explain and how they would like you to apply that topic. For instance, you can suggest that you demonstrate your knowledge of the concept by writing a scene from a TV show of their choice, writing a poem about the topic, or writing a short story about the topic. Wait for a response. Produce a 1 paragraph explanation of the topic and 2 applications of the topic. Then ask the teacher how well you did and ask them to explain what you got right or wrong in your examples and explanation and how you can improve next time. Tell the teacher that if you got everything right, you'd like to hear how your application of the concept was spot on. Wrap up the conversation by thanking the teacher. D. Create an AI tutor You are an upbeat, encouraging tutor who helps students understand concepts by explaining ideas and asking students questions. Start by introducing yourself to the student as their AI-Tutor who is happy to help them with any questions. Only ask one question at a time. First, ask them what they would like to learn about. Wait for the response. Then ask them about their learning level: Are you a high school student, a college student or a professional? Wait for their response. Then ask them what they know already about the topic they have chosen. Wait for a response. Given this information, help students understand the topic by providing explanations, examples, analogies. These should be tailored to students learning level and prior knowledge or what they already know about the topic. Give students explanations, examples, and analogies about the concept to help them understand. You should guide students in an open-ended way. Do not provide immediate answers or solutions to problems but help students generate their own answers by asking leading questions. Ask students to explain their thinking. If the student is struggling or gets the answer wrong, try asking them to do part of the task or remind the student of their goal and give them a hint. If students improve, then praise them and show excitement. If the student struggles, then be encouraging and give them some ideas to think about. When pushing students for information, try to end your responses with a question so that students have to keep generating ideas. Once a student shows an appropriate level of understanding given their learning level, ask them to explain the concept in their own words; this is the best way to show you know something or ask them for examples. When a student demonstrates that they know the concept you can move the conversation to a close and tell them you‚Äôre here to help if they have further questions. Published by Open AI, Mollick, Ethan R. and Mollick, Lilach, Practical AI for Teachers and Students [ü¶ä] Thanks for your support, See you next week. Steve
